description:
Pane E Vino serves classic Italian food with great service. Dishes include a big plate of fresh food (the fresh pasta items are the best!) and each meal comes with warm bread. Pane E Vino's olive oil tastes so good with the bread and is definitely different from the olive oil you might find in a typical grocery store (add salt and pepper into the oil for extra flavor!)

The menu for this place is huge and includes a ton of different Italian dishes. The server was very friendly when I couldn't decide on which pasta dish to get and he said he would "surprise me" with his favorite. It ended up being the "pappardelle con funghi galletti e prosciutto" from the specials menu. It was basically wide egg noodles in a cream sauce that was so delicious. 

Pane E Vino is a bit pricey but I would say the price is pretty spot on for this type of "date night" restaurant. I think this place also caters to an older crowd; at one point during my dinner I looked around the full restaurant and noticed that my table was the only one that has diners under 30 years old. Even so, the environment was homely and inviting - I didn't feel out of place despite the age gap. 

I plan on coming back and trying a few other pastas as well as ordering a wine from their huge wine menu!
author: Michelle T.

description:
This restaurant obviously panders to a certain crowd. A crowd that looking around is probably retired or close to. 
The service was slow but friendly. The bus boys were quick to clear plates but never refilled water. 
I had a glass of Prosecco, and would have liked a second one with my main course but was never attended to by the waiter or service staff. 
My friend had the Scallops as an appetizer, they were fragrant in all the wrong ways but apparently palatable to him. He rated them 5 out of 10. 
My entree was the Risotto with Seafood and it was bland/plain (probably to cater to older palates) the shrimp was hard and had more bite then most of the clientele and I could not eat much more as it was simply unappetizing. An Entree for 25 dollars and I will probably hunt down a slice of pizza else where on my way home. 
This was a major disappointment on all levels.
author: Laurence T.

description:
If your looking for a place where they use prepackaged dried pastas, basic table bread and basically cater to the seniors of Pacific Heights old money crowd you've found the place. 

My date and I were sat fairly quickly after a couple who had a reservations. We were sat inbetween a loud group next to us and the couple who had reservations. The host was disingenuous with his service and our waiter was hardly seen throughout the meal. I got the clams vongole and my date got the spaghetti with meatballs. Hers looked better than mine but she only ate maybe half of it. My clams were very briney and I had a few with sand still in them... My pasta was undercooked and the sauce was less than average.

Needless to say Im not coming back here not only on my experience but the lighting and decor was less than ideal. The price was good and affordable but I felt like being at an old folks home being in there. Also, part of the restaurant looks like a deli with a refrigerated display case... so strange.
author: Alex G.

description:
3.5 stars

TL;DR fairly unremarkable interior and limited seating, but great food. That house bread and olive oil....oh, my.

We had...

ENTREES: Capricciosa Pizza and Roasted Half Chicken (special). The pizza was one of the best I've had and tasted great even the next day. (FWIW, I'm a Chicagoan. I've been told this makes me some sort of pizza guru..go figure.).

DESSERT: Profiteroles. These were filled with gelato, not cream as they traditionally are (and as the menu had written). The chocolate shells were no bueno.

COFFEE: Espresso and Cappuccino. The capp was delish!


Service was okay -- not overwhelmingly friendly or quick, but decent. We were also celebrating a special occasion, and our servers either forgot or were unaware.
author: Nic Z.

description: Very delightful dinner.  Loved the bread and olive oil.  Was going to buy a bottle of olive oil.  Really enjoyed the pasta.  Loved the server, who was funny.
author: Helen L.

description:
Excellent service by Favio and the rest of the staff.

The special antipasti Guazzeto Di Pesce (similar to cioppino with clams, mussels, shrimp and calamari in a delicious slightly spicy tomato sauce) was fantastic. For sure I'll have this again $19.95

The special Pappardelle con Funghi Galletie Prosciutto (extra wide egg noodles, chantrelle mushrooms, cream snd prosciutto) was awesome $22.95

The Montepulciano d'Abruzzo wine was great ($11 per glass)

The bruschetta has the most tomatoes I've ever had. Delicious.

The dessert gelato was delicious although a bit too pricey at $10.

The dessert Profiteroles's cream puff seemed old $10.

The coffee seemed like Nescafe.

Overall this is a great Italian restaurant.
author: Vic M.

description:
After seeing Aladdin, we stopped by Pane E Vino for dinner. We parked at a parking structure a couple blocks away and it was not very crowded around 5:30. 

Everything was delicious.  From the olive oil to the last bite of dessert, the food was so good. They served bread with real extra virgin olive oil for dipping. The spinach salad was excellent and even the regular dinner salad was good.  They were not overly dressed and the pancetta added the special touch to the spinach salad. The calamari was crispy and the marinara sauce served on the side was super flavorful. The ravioli covered in browned butter and marinara sauce was amazing. The chicken with vegetables was also delicious. The penne with cream sauce was great and not too rich. The desserts were not super heavy and they tasted great. The cheesecake was creamy and not too rich. The fruit tart was light and the cream went well with the tart berries. My favorite dessert was the affogato. It was the first time I had every tried an affogato and it tasted like the best coffee ice cream I had ever had.

Overall, the whole food experience was delightful. The service was great and the restaurant had a relaxed atmosphere.  I do not typically order dessert when I go out for a meal, but a three course meal is a must here. If you are in the area, stop by and try this place.
author: Michelle D.

description: We had a big family dinner for 20. The owner was more than accommodating and gave us our own table in back. The food and service was delicious! For appetizers, we had antipasto (cured meats and vegetables), salad, and pizza (white and mushroom, mushroom was my favorite). I ordered the capellini pomodorro for dinner. My wife and I loved it! Angel hair pasta with tomatoes, garlic, and basil (STRONGLY RECOMMEND). For dessert, everyone share multiple affogatos and tiramisu. Both desserts were delicious, everyone cleared the plates. Overall great service, incredible food, and relaxing atmosphere. Anytime our family comes to San Francisco we'll come to Pane E Vino.
author: Dustin B.

description:
If we've a large party and a special occasion this is where we come. Tried and true. Lot to be said for that when you're feeding many and don't want to experiment with food or service. 
Both here are terrific. We were 11 people this time and were well-cared for from start to finish. The service never waivers. They're accommodating and check in regularly in an unobtrusive manner. Whatever you need they're happy to accommodate. Not one of these places that sighs when you ask for more or different. 
The antipasto starters for the table are delicious. Cured meats and pickled vegetables are just perfect to whet your appetite. We had everything from salmon to pasta, pork and steak; the food is terrific. 
If you need a go to real Italian San Francisco flavored restaurant, then this is a lovely place to come. We will of course be back.
author: Peddie A.

description:
Oh man, was this spot delicious! A little piece of Italy hidden in a rather unassuming neighborhood spot, if you will! (The wait staff even speak in Italian).

Was visiting with a friend, and Italian food had to happen while we were in town. Found this spot, and decided to reserve a table using their website (It wasn't crazy busy at first, but it picked up fairly quickly after being seated, so I'd recommend reserving a spot!). We were seated upon arrival, and provided with excellent service throughout our visit.

The free appetizer bread w/olive oil was stellar (great, crunchy crust with a airy, soft crumb). I ordered the fettuccine al formaggi with a glass of wine, and was treated to some of the best pasta I've come across in quite some time, as well as ever! My only regret is that there wasn't enough time in my short visit to SF to come back and try some more stuff here.

Come here, and forget about counting calories for a day. You'll be glad you did!
author: Andrew K.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for date night on a Saturday around 7:45pm. We were expecting a long wait, but it was only 15 minutes! Definitely a crowded spot though, and would recommend making a reservation.

Wine: we brought our own bottle, and the corkage fee was $30. A little expensive, but not terrible. Most bottles there were around $40- $50.

Food: the bread they give you is BOMB. it came out hot and fresh. I wanted to get a salad, but none of them on the menu seemed that appetizing to me. They were all pretty plain. We each got a pasta- he got the linguine- frutto de mare and I got the the truffle mushroom pasta that's not on the menu. They unfortunately did not have the special tagliarini that it's usually made with, but they let me pick which pasta I wanted which was nice. I got fettuccini. Overall, the sauce of the pasta was really good, but I saw some other pictures on yelp that had shaved parmesan slices which I did not get. I enjoyed it and it was a good size portion, so I would give it 4/5. I think if I had gotten the taligarini, it would have been 5/5.

Overall: I would come here again for the same pasta dish. Kind of annoying that there's a $2 per person charge... just because. with no reason.
author: Jenna G.

description: The patio is where to be. The food is great and the selection is incredible! We went with a large party and they were able to accommodate quickly. The patio makes you feel like you're in Italy somehow. I loved it.
author: Gianna P.

description: Wow! We had a family dinner at Pane e Vino on Saturday, and our group of 12 had a fantastic meal. We had pre-arranged a set menu with several appetizers and a choice of main course. We all enjoyed a house salad and platters of their Antipasto Della Casa, then an assortment of pizzas. Our main course options were delicious and our group was commenting on how tasty the pasta, chicken, and salmon were. We were well tended by servers and they were so accommodating with bringing out our own cake that we had brought, and singing happy birthday to my brother. It was a lively and lovely evening with family and friends and we will be back soon for another great meal!
author: Alison J.

description: Great place, the service was a bit uncomfortable specially when we asked to split the bill between the four families, I understand it is work but there was not clients anymore they had lots of time and we were a party of 30 people, the server just came by and left, we asked him to help and he just walked away mad. We had Been there the night before and went back with a big party, so I think they should've noticed we liked them place. I think they need to pay more attention to clients.
author: Custo A.

description:
Love this place. The food is a little uneven but it has such a wonderful selection of pastas. It's a big menu without being overwhelming. It is not the same old same old menu that you would get around town with just spaghetti and meatballs and basic boring stuff. Their pastas are truly great. Highlights include the Penette, the Fusilli, the Bolognese and the Bucatini.   The Steak (bistecca) is also great. As is the Seabass. 

There are things on the menu that don't always live up, but overall it's very yummy, cozy place.
author: JT B.

description: I love the food and casual atmosphere here! Good for first dates or family dinners. My favorite is the simple capellini dish but all the pastas are good. The service can be SUPER slow so don't go before a show but it is usually worth the wait.
author: Alicia D.

description: Delish! We were walking by and looked at the menu came back after they opened.  They were totally booked with reservations but did have seating in the back which was perfect.  Very friendly.  Bread was great  but would have been better with parmesan  cheese to dip in with the olive oil.    Dinner was solo good and they pizza was to die for.   Again delish and would go back in  heart beat!!!  Keep up the great work !!!!!
author: Angel S.

description: Popped in late near closing time to find a full house.  Didn't think we could get seated but they got us in and did it with a smile. We had a great meal, very solid pasta offering, nice portions size.  Service was likewise fantastic, warm and inviting and they didn't rush us.  Thank you!
author: Eric M.

description:
I came here for the first time last night with a friend. It was packed and we didn't have a reservation but we were seated immediately. Both of our pasta dishes were fantastic and we were stuffed by the end of dinner. 

Our bill came out to $67.16, we split the tab and it came out to $34 even. It's not a big deal, considering it's only 84 cents, but why was our bill rounded up? If they do that to every customer, that can add up. Anyways, good Italian spot, but I'll keep exploring for others in the area.
author: Amy L.

description: Had dinner reservations, seated within a few minutes. The restaurant is small but provides a romantic setting. The food we had was good, standard Italian menu options. Service was quick and friendly.
author: Jasson C.

description:
I have been coming here for more than 18 years. Like way back when it was in the location where Terzo is. The food has gone completely down hill. 

1.  Artichoke app is tasteless. Period. 
2.  Papardelle alla contadina (chicken and pink sauce) - I have had solely this fish for years and it was bland and tasteless. 
3.  Baked Eggplant app (think eggplant lasagna) - ok
Service - I asked for parmesan cheese around 3-4 times before it came.

Honestly, food is most important and I am not coming back here again which is too bad because the neighborhood needs a homey Italian restaurant (and don't tell me contrada is homey).
author: Deal G.

description:
Came here for dinner with my team from work and was surprised by how fun their service was. We tried ordering wine but they didn't have the bottle we wanted so they kept offering us another bottle that was more expensive. 

Their bread here is really good and we also demolished their prosciutto board pretty quickly though it didn't come with any melon :/. I got the truffle mushroom pasta which was so good, and my friends calzone looked awesome too. 

They also threw in a couple of tiramisius on the house which was super nice! 

Price point is a bit more expensive but worth checking out compared to lots of north beach places for Italian!
author: Kristie M.

description:
Another smashing success at dinner with a buddy this past Monday. Instead of pasta, I went for the lamb scottadito, with veggies. It was to die for.

Thank you guys!

A shout out to Fabio
author: Massimo M.

description: I don't usually get fish at an Italian restaurant, but while flipping through Yelp reviews I saw several pics of grilled white fish that were reminiscent of meals I enjoyed while in the Mediterranean. Moments after I showed the chef he exclaimed, "ah the branzino!" He assured me it was grilled, no butter, "just olive oil" and would be great. I accepted. When the meal came I became thrilled as each bit was perfect. The delicate fish was grilled to perfection and not a minute overdone like so many other careless places. It was served on a bed of thinly-sliced moist potatoes and served with a side of veggies. It was such a simple dish, fish, olive oil, pepper, salt, but the irony is that the most simple dishes are the easiest to mess up. I can't wait to return.
author: Brian J.

description:
Its my all time favorite Italian restaurant where you cant go wrong with the food. 

- Classic, old school; cozy ambiance in the main room. 
- They have extra sitting at the back glass room with is great for large groups/parties. 
- The service is superb, very attentive. 
- Its always busy with regular returning customers. So best to call ahead to do a reservation. 
- The secret which is not on the menu but has a loyal fan following is the Truffle mushroom pasta, its delish and turns me into a vegetarian every time.
- The portions are good individual portions.
- If 2 people, best to take the carafe of wine to share for $22

 Good hearty Italian food in SF.
author: Payal B.

description: Date night with wife. Wednesday night seemed busy but they got us a table right away. Had the antipasto plate to start. It was like we were back in Italy. Wife had risotto. It was great! I had veal scallopoini. It was great also. The service was the best I've had in a long time.
author: Keith M.

description:
We went to pane e vino for my sister's birthday celebration a few weekends back. Had a reservation, but got there 15 mins late. They had saved the table for us and we were seated immediately in the enclosed patio area. The staff was friendly and attentive. 

We got a lot of food - 

Minestrone soup - light and filling, a little lacking in seasoning.
Bruschetta - great
Caprese - Good
Insalata pane e vino - decent

A made to order veggie pasta with marinara sauce - good
Mushroom and black truffle pasta - not on menu, special request - amazing!
Veggie risotto - completely lacking in flavors- definitely skip this one.
Margherita pizza-  simple yet tasty - awesome.
The chef special fish dish - cant really recall the type of fish, but the dish was tasty.

Profitroles - cream puffs with gelato and chocolate - decent stuff
Afogatto - delicious.

Overall a good meal with family.
author: Dee V.

description:
I have not eaten at Pane E Vino since they moved from Steiner street probably 10 years ago...maybe more.

I must say the meal was just okay. The ambiance is really cute and the place was buzzing for a Wednesday. Service was pretty friendly, albeit my friend eats there all the time and they know her there really well.

Food: The misto salad tasted fresh but it was just a salad no surprises there. The mushroom pizza was good but a tad soggy on the bottom...bummer for a thin crust pizza. I am going to be totally honest California Pizza kitchen had a much better thin crust pizza. 

The pasta, a tagliatelle with meat ragu was actually pretty good. Nice all dente spinach and egg pasta with a hearty meat sauce. Pasta was cooked well not over salted and the meat sauce had wonderful flavor ( probably the best part of pre dessert meal). Our roasted chicken was very very mediocre. Flabby chicken with meah skin and meah potatoes and vegetables...pass.

The sangiovese glass of wine was pretty great and the pour was very generous.

Desserts were excellent: Tiramisu was tasty albeit small and the cheesecake was rich and delicious.

Would I go back???   maybe....but there are some really dynamite Italian restaurants in the city that I would much prefer to go to.
author: David G.

description:
Great b-day dinner for my dad on a Saturday. Located in the quieter section of Union and apparently a strong local following with several shop owners and other patrons greeting each other and the staff. Made reservations ahead of time so were seated immediately. Certainly busy but not overtly crowded.
Good variety of some traditional Italian offerings along with a list of specials. We started with a bean soup of the day and a lovely caprese salad. Entrees included 3 pasta dishes: smoked salmon with bowtie in a beautiful light cream sauce, pappardelle with grilled chicken & porcini in a light tomato cream sauce, and my favorite of the 3: rigatoni with sausage, the tomato sauce had a wonderful flavor enhanced by the sausage
For dessert we shared a seasonal berry tart (raspberry) and a good tiramisu slice.
Only negative, no recognition of my dad's b-day even after putting notes on the reservation and making a point to order dessert
author: Kat H.

description: after a long day of being tourists at fishermans warf, we felt like we were transported to italy when we walked into the back patio. the service was prompt, everyone was speaking Italian, the food was flavorful (not to mention the wine was out of this world) this spot is a treasure.
author: Sarah B.

description: The food here tastes so good. Just as good as food in Italy. This is my go to Italian restaurant.  I kind of don't want to let the secret out, but I feel like I owe it to the world.
author: Kathryn W.

description:
I made a reservation for my daughters birthday solely off of Yelp reviews.  I am so happy I did!  I wanted the dinner to be special for my daughter and her friends....and moms too, so I called Salvatore at least 4 times with questions.  Each time he was polite, and gracious, and assured me all would be ok.  He was right, it was awesome!  We had a large table in the back and it was just perfect.  There were others dining in the same area, however it still felt very private.  
Everything was awesome, the food, atmosphere and the wait staff!!!  Thank you for helping to make my daughters birthday celebration memorable!
author: Lin C.

description:
This place is lovely. I am surprised I've never been here before since it is so close to my house. My fiancé and I came here when I was too lazy to cook dinner and we didn't want to walk far. 

As soon as we entered, it smelled really great. There was a combination of tourists and locals. 

Our server was hustling. I appreciated that he knew the menu super well, even when we butchered the Italian. He was able to recommend us wine as well. 

Beware on the wine. They poured our glasses super full. My pizza was solid and my fiancé loved  her mussel and clam linguini. 

I would come again if I was entertaining my family or taking a picky eater out.
author: Mitch C.

description: Some of the best Italian food we've had! We happened to walk by and decide to eat here, and what a good decision that was! They were busy, but quick to find us a nice place to eat.  I ordered the ravioli which was made fresh that day - it was AMAZING! So so so good. My husband had a margarita pizza (baked in the stone fire oven) and it was also amazing... Everything was so fresh and tasty.  The staff were so lovely and the atmosphere was charming.  I'd definitely go back and I 100% recommend this restaurant.
author: Leanne J.

description:
It's been several years since my friend and I visited what was once a fantastic restaurant. Last night we returned and were deeply disappointed in our food experience. The service, as always, was professional and warm; however, the same cannot be said for what we were served.

We began with the mozzarella caprese. At the peak of summer when tomatoes are at their best, the three slices presented were hard and tasteless and the mozzarella no better than what one might find in a supermarket. The overpriced calamari fritti was disappointing served with a tasteless tomato goo. In view of the first two courses, the penne puttanesca was OK, however, the bread and recommended rosé wine were very good. 

Time to get the kitchen crew together and bring this place back to its former level of quality!
author: Tom B.

description:
I have been here twice and had a great meal both times.  The bread is fresh and delicious, the wine list is good, the service is perfect, love the ambiance, oh and the food is delicious! 

My favorite are the pastas and pizza.  Authentic, simple, perfect.  

Highly recommend.
author: Cari N.

description: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome..... Did I mention Awesome..... We live in St. Louis Mo, home of the Italian area called "the hill". Real authentic classic Italian foods, with no less than 20 highly rated restaurants. Simply a huge benchmark to compete against. And did Pane E Vino do that, they defined freshness and service. Easily finer than anything we have here. I requested if the Seafood pasta could be made with White Wine sauce instead of the Red, served perfectly. We also had the Fettuccine. It had the right balance of cream sauce, not over bearing like some. Everything was so fresh.... Get there early as the place filled up quick. Definitely on my top 5 list period.... You have set a higher bar for our local Italian favorites. We will be back, next time in San Fran, thank you very much Pane E Vino..... I forgot to mention, we regret not grabbing one of those deserts after that meal.... Next time for sure!!
author: George M.

description:
Loved this place as it has an old school feel! 

Love the eggplant parmigiana as it is not salty at all. It is moist as well so it is juicy and not dry. 

The burrata was fresh but I did not get to really ascertain how it tasted because the serving was not that generous unlike the Burrata serving size  at Cowgirl, Ferry Bldg. It had only one dollop. At first bite, it seemed fresh and good. 

My friend had the putanesca which was OK according to him.

Excellent customer service esp by Jose, the food runner/ bus boy who kept my water filled up, bread basket and olive oil dip refilled, and even ran after me to give me my sweater which I forgot. Jose is due for a raise!

Clean restrooms!  The only caution is this restaurant has no valet service and everything here in this area is street parking but it is also residential. We had to park near Fort Mason and walk back so that we can park our car.

Recommended.
author: Kitty D.

description: This place was like a little piece of Italy, the food was delicious and the service was outstanding. They give great recommendations if one were to be indecisive, and the final presentation of they're platters can't go unrecognized. Overall, it was a great way to spend a Sunday evening with my family.
author: Jullianna C.

description: This is more a review of how well we were treated than a review of the food.  My wife and I are both vegans and were in a rush to get to the theater last Friday.  From the moment we arrived at Pane e Vino we were taken care of graciously and promptly by the maitre d.  He informed us of a short wait and minutes later gave us the option to sit at the bar.  We accepted and let him know we needed to get to a show by 8.  He expedited everything food, biil, cc and 30 minutes later we left having had a delicious if rather fast meal.  Thank you, thank you, thank you.
author: Scott W.

description:
OH HO HO haaaapppy tummy... This place is dangerously good. 

The first time I came here I was pleasantly surprised by how it was ACTUALLY an Italian restaurant in SF with actual Italian men cooking- so for that A+.

First stop - seafood appetizers: #holymoley. Fresh tomato sauces that were more alive than anything I've ever tasted, bruschetta you could die for, and then stepping into entree land was like a walk in wonderland. Everything. Everything we ordered was perfect.

I left happy, full, and probably buzzed. 

Now as I sit in my food coma writing this review it is with great joy that I report this place did it again. Like wow. Ummazing truffle pasta- incredible eggplant with smoked moz and hell yes- even the olive oil was on point.

There was no room for dessert. I repeat: no room for dessert. 

As far as other things you need to know: call ahead for more than 2 people and ask to be in the main room. Back room = a little lame. 

Corkage fee is $20 and a pretty good idea because the wine list is okay but $$$$.

That said. Food is SF-reasonable ($$)

Also, one of the best things about this place is that while is nice and in a great location - it's not prissy. The people are cool, waitstaff is there when you need them and no more than that. And the vibe is very family/friendsy. 

Go, go go, go GO.
author: Andrea D.

description: This is our go-to place in Cow Hollow.  The soups change every day and are always excellent, as is the service.
author: William W.

description: Cozy atmosphere. Good for a chill date night or a small group because it's not loud. Good service and  traditional Italian food.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco.

Small 40 person dining room but has a nice patio outback.

Pasta dishes are authentic and unique, no fettuccine alfredo here!

Pasta dishes range from $14-20, and you're getting bang for your buck. Medium portions, but food is rich and fresh.

The only odd thing to me is that appetizers are priced similarly to pasta dishes so are therefore a bit expensive. A caprese pasta will cost you $13.50, and a house salad $9.50.

Still, this place is great, give it a shot!
author: Peter T.

description: Wow!  Came here just because we could walk from our hotel. What a find!! Great food, good service, nice atmosphere. Worth the price, and more. Try it next time you're in the city.
author: Frank S.

description: The owner and staff are very welcoming. Getting seated in the back patio is highly recommended.
author: Dan M.

description: Such an enjoyable experience. Good Italian dish, not heavy garlic, clean flavors. Waitstaff very attentive and helped with choices.
author: Lisabeth L.

description:
We walked into this place on Saturday evening spur of the moment. We were hungry for some good Italian, so I consulted Yelp! Even though they were booked, they fit us in! We really appreciated that. The floor manager is a great guy, I can't remember his name (I had quite a few mimosas that day). 

The restaurant has a nice, homey vibe, and it smelled incredible! They brought out bread with oil and balsamic vinegar, yum! We got a nice bottle of cab for the table and ordered our entree. I heard no complaints from anyone at the table, just silent, happy eating people. My own entree was wonderful, when I want comfort food, I always go for angel hair pasta with Alfredo sauce. A very simple dish but it had the best Alfredo sauce I've ever had.. Which says a lot! Because I order it frequently. The others ordered more complicated dishes. The price was where it should be. The only thing that brought down one star was our server, we had to look for him a lot and he wasn't as attentive as he should have been, he was also snappy with the birthday girl who had asked a simple, sweet question. Tame the cranky Sir!

When I go back to San Fransisco, I will eat here again, I recommend it.
author: Lauren G.

description: Pane e vino is my favorite Italian spot in the city. It's super under the radar and a locals go-to. You won't find tourists here and patrons may know the owners. Very cozy. The pasta is homemade and tastes like it. Check it out - or don't so we can keep the crowd down.
author: Courtney C.

description:
What a delight! I wanted authentic pasta for my birthday dinner and this place didn't disappoint. 

The service was impeccable - our host was cheery and knowledgeable about the menu.  The food was delicious. There's a private room in the back for large groups - I might just have to reserve it soon for my family when they visit!
author: Kathryn D.

description:
Ordered the mushroom pizza and a mista salad.  Supposed to have olive oil on the salad but had some thick, yellow nasty dressing instead.  Pizza was supposed to have wild mushrooms, but had button mushrooms.  Ate the dinner and got SICK AS A DOG less than 30 minutes later.  Threw up TWICE!  Can you said FOOD POISONING????????   I don't know what it was or if the food was UNWASHED And UNSANITARY!  But I was dizzy and throwing up! 

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS !  UNLESS OF COURSE YOU WANT FOOD POISONING!
author: gina b.

description:
Came here tonight with a reservation. Was totally disappointed with the host at the door. We were 20 mins early before our reservations and there were plenty of tables free but he didn't care to sit us down. Until 5 minutes before our reservation I got paranoid and asked  him to sit us and he still refused and said it is not your reservation time yet. Excuse me? No one else is coming and you have more than 4 empty tables. At last he unprofessionally and disrespectfully told us to sit. After dinner we waited for 20 minutes for our dessert menu. He gave other tables the menu but purposely neglected us. He is the most unprofessionally and disrespectful host I have ever met.  Thanks to our waiter who at last gave us the menu. 

The food and the waiter who took our orders and served our table were fantastic though. We love our waiter who was attentive and friendly, unlike the host. It is sad that I have to give 2 stars instead of 5 all because of the host.
author: JJJ W.

description:
Came here for a dinner date with the BF on a Saturday night and was so glad to have reservations - the restaurant was entirely filled, and after dining there I can definitely understand why. 

Pane E Vino is a simple and affordable Italian restaurant tucked away on a street corner. It offers no frills service and simple, amazing and affordable food and wine. Don't expect super polite wait staff to fawn all over you- all you'll get is quick, efficient, no nonsense service. And when there's good food to be had, that's A-OK with me. 

We sat down and were promptly served by a waiter - I ordered the Pappardelle special which had mushrooms and pancetta in a cream sauce, while my boyfriend had the Parppadelle with chicken and porcini mushrooms in the tomato sauce. OH MY GOD. I have to say my dish was mindblowingly good - the pasta was hand made, and oh-so-delicious, and the sauce, oh god the sauce was to die for. I am not usually a fan of cream sauces, but this one was perfect, it was ridiculously delicious without making you feel sick or overwhelmed at the end. At the end of the meal, all I wanted to do was to lick my plate which was pretty much what I did... with the remnants of the bread basket. The boyfriend's pasta was also quite tasty but I don't remember anything of the evening aside from my super delicious to die for orgasmic pasta dish.

We ended off the evening with a fresh seasonal fruit tart which tasted neither fresh nor seasonal, but after that delicious pasta dish, this place can do no wrong. I am already dreaming of my next visit.
author: Sarah T.

description: My buddy and I stroll in on a Sunday evening. I wasn't expecting it to be busy because it was Sunday, but this place was, which is a good sign, no? Miraculously, there were two seats available at the counter area, which we did not hesitate to take. We promptly ordered wine and we wet for the three cheese ravioli and sword fish. The bread and olive oil was your typical stuff, but we were impressed by the food. I have not tasted more delicious ravioli than I did here. I wish I would have had the stomach space to order a whole other plate of it because it was good. We then opted for the Profiteroles, which are white chocolate gelato filled cream puffs topped with hot chocolate sauce! This was heaven! I can't wait to go back.
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: This is probably a five star place, but I'm stingy with those. That said we had a great experience. Small place with a feel of home. Attentive staff and great food. Went for a birthday and found them through yelp after our chosen restaurant had our reservations so late. We were able to get earlier reservation times and was a busy Saturday night. Highly recommend.
author: John P.

description:
Wow - incredible. We could have just had the salads and deserts!  The food is delicious and service is very on top of the game. 

We did make reservations and that was the best recommendation Yelp handed out. It got crowded very quickly.  And they have a lot of take-out customers keeping the kitchen busy. 

A terrific place, terrific food, great service.
author: Phil J.

description:
This used to be a favorite. But the last few years it has gone down hill fast. After 3 disappointing dining experiences in a row. I had to accept that this old grey goose isn't what she used to be.
Aside from the food being hit and miss. The artwork is hideous. Like a plague that spread on their walls.
author: Cindy B.

description:
We are back in SF after one year and for our first dinner we decided to come back in this restaurant for the third time (twice one year ago) The food is still great. Definitely one of the best Italian ever experienced in the USA. From anti pasti to desserts, via wine list, everything is awesome. 
Plus, even though there is no kids menu, they propose half plates for half the price (seems logical to you, huh!), and won't charge you for sharing your dessert (logical again?). 
I highly recommend this place to Italian foodies. To all foodies actually.
author: Jordi M.

description:
My girlfriends and I went to Pane e Vino for dinner on a recent Friday evening. The restaurant is small and had a charming feel of a casual, neighborhood spot. With a reservation, we were seated within a few minutes. We started with the baked eggplant, spinach salad with pancetta and egg, and a bottle of prosecco. The prosecco was the perfect way to start the meal, but we were mostly left unimpressed with the food. The baked eggplant arrived hot and full of molten cheese, but was under-seasoned. The spinach salad was fine, but nothing to write home about--although I thought it was odd that they served it with slivers of a hard boiled egg instead of a soft boiled egg that would have served well with bigger pieces of pancetta. 

As for the entrees, my friends and I shared the angel hair pasta with fresh tomato sauce, linguine with clams and mussels, and pizza marguerita. The pizza was forgettable, and the linguine was incredibly under-seasoned. It could have used more salt, pepper, and a hit of acidity. The angel hair pasta dish was the best out of the bunch, but it tasted a bit heavy which isn't what you expect from a fresh tomato sauce. 

Service was good--they even brought out a complimentary tiramisu (which was delicious) with a candle for my friend's birthday--and prices we're reasonable (less than $40 per person for the whole meal, including 2 bottles of wine and tip). They do take reservations via OpenTable, so that's convenient. Overall, the food was disappointing, considering that SF is such a food-centric city. We had a good time, but I would go elsewhere for good Italian cuisine.
author: Parada O.

description:
I had a delicious eggplant parmigiana. The work group I was with seemed to enjoy their dishes which ranged from steak - pizza - grilled fish -- pasta -- salad.

The service wasn't very good though. It took a long time to order the food, to serve the food, and to get the check. But...we sat for a long time and I never felt rushed. ;-)
author: Leslie K.

description: Horrible. Instead of pappardelle with porcini they gave us pappardelle with shiitake mushrooms. Service was horrible too. Think management of this restaurant have changed cause last time I've been here 5 years ago it was amazing...
author: Vlad E.

description: This is an excellent Italian restaurant! My boyfriend and I were visiting for the week and couldn't be happier that we stumbled upon this place. We shared the Cesar salad, black truffle mushroom pasta and cheesecake for desert. Soo satisfied afterwards.
author: Alice T.

description:
Was recommended to check out Vino's by a friend for dinner on a Friday night. We didn't have a reservation, so the wait was around 45 minutes, which isn't too bad compared to the other waits we had for other restaurants that weekend. They put us down and gave us a time to return. They even told us we can walk around the area and come back at that time and that they would definitely have a table for us, which we did.

We got the Bruschetta Carciofini al Olio, Salsicce Italiana mini-Pizza, and Fettucine con Prosciutto e Funghi. 

The Bruschetta had a ton of flavor, and each one was overflowing with the toppings. It was actually a lot for 2 people.

Skip the pizza. Snobbish New Yorker here, but I was expecting somewhat authentic pizza at an Italian restaurant, but alas, disappointed again. 

But the Fettucine. It was more than enough for 2 people. Actually, the table next to us seemed to barely touch their pasta as well, and had to take it to go, but as it turns out, each plate consists of a lot more than you expect. They even separated it into two plates for us.

The fettucine was definitely the highlight though. Al dente pasta, not overly oily or watery for the sauce, and just the right amount prosciutto, tomatoes and mushrooms. The sauce was actually too good, and I scraped the rest of it with the extra bread that we asked for.

The place is pretty small, being in the back room of a hotel, and I could have reached over to snag a bite of my neighbor's food if I wanted to. But it wasn't overly loud, and service was good (although the waiter hovered a little too close to my face at times). If you're looking for a last minute somewhat casual/fancy (we came in hoodies and sweats), come for the pasta. Just the pasta.
author: Benson C.

description:
"Bueno Sera!" I soon heard exchanged between my grandma and the host, I immediately had flashbacks about my Italy trip two summers ago - expectations were high! 

On the table you are served warm complimentary bread with a small dish of olive oil for dipping... Addicting!!! 
We started off with the ANTIPASTO DELLA CASA which included prosciutto on 2 cracker sticks, 2 pieces of flavorful bruschetta, salami and coppa scattered throughout, succulent not-to-spicy peperoncinis, voluptuous olives, grilled charbroiled-like tasting eggplant and a pile of pickled peppers. The meat was thin and fresh, and the peppers were tasty. Wish there was more and had some cheese. (See pic) 

For my entree I ordered PAPPARDELLE ALLA CONTADINA since I love wide pasta/noodle. It got to me nice and warm, noodles having the right thickness and delicate texture. The creamy tomato sauce was light and had a soft taste which made me want it more. There were a lot of mushrooms that really tasted like mushrooms. The chicken is breast but had a simple but kind of bland taste, which was ok since it provided some protein. (See pic) 

My dad and grandma both requested their own creation which consisted of simply tagliarini noodles with meat sauce. They ordered it since my grandma used to make some bomb homemade pesto with tagliarini noodles. They were both thoroughly satisfied with their meals, cleaning the bowl. They said the noodles were perfect and the sauce had more meat and less tomato which they liked since they aren't fans of acidic/greasy spaghetti sauce. (See pic) 

My dad also ordered an iced tea which they gave him his own small pitcher along with his glass. 

My sister ordered the CALZONE which she enjoyed due to the soft crust, fresh ingredients which can be tasted in each bite. It smelled really good when it arrived to her, giving off a nice buttery aroma. There was a generous amount of marina filling up almost half the plate on the folded part of the calzone. 

My sister and I ordered tiramisu for dessert which was pretty good. The mascarpone was rich and the cocoa powder gave it a hint of chocolate. It didn't seem like there was any rum, or at least a taste of rum, which disappointed the inner alchy in me.  

The service was exceptional, giving off positive vibes as well accommodating my dad's custom pasta. 

Overall, I give this place 4 stars. Has potential. Will come again and try a pizza since there was a steady flow of to go orders getting picked up during my dinner.
author: Kevin C.

description:
We arrived right after opening on a Saturday night without a reservation and were seated right away on the back patio, which is adorable. I had high expectations because of the name, pane and vino (bread and wine), which I love.

How did we start the evening, you might wonder? With pane e vino of course! Bread and olive oil were yummy and the drink menu is extremely affordable--I ordered a refresher prosecco & bitters cocktail for $6 and my date ordered a glass of Chianti for $6-$8 I believe. 

Our meal beyond the bread and wine was OK. Even though the restaurant was not full, our meal took a while (we had to order another basket of bread while waiting). 

My date ordered the rabbit special, which was delicious, except that it was not de-boned so it was like working through an obstacle course to get to the meat (to be fair, neither of us has eaten rabbit before, we could just be naive about this, but it was not an enjoyable experience). 

I ordered the butternut squash ravioli, and while it was tasty, I was disappointed at the quantity--there were maybe 8 thin ravioli and the tomato sauce on top looked and tasted like it was from a can. Even with the second order of bread and my main meal, I was not satiated.

I would recommend this place to enjoy its so-named items--bread and wine (and maybe an appetizer). 

I'll just add Italian dinners in North Beach tend to be the best of the best in SF, so gauge your expectations when indulging in Italian in another part of the city.
author: Ashley P.

description: Great neighborhood place that I have had the pleasure to enjoy for many years now. You can have an easy quick meal or you can go all-in and enjoy the passion the Chef/owner Bruno put in every single dish and choose from a broad wine list. I had dinner alone at the bar, dinner for 2, 4,6 and more in the dining room and had large private parties in the room they have in the back and while  I often ask to be seated in Dario's station since I got to know him over the years,  I never had a bad experience there while dining in nor when I ordered food to be picked up. Carlos has always been extremely welcoming and I feel that just like Bruno they never miss a day at their restaurant. Grazie Mille.
author: A. G.

description:
After a show my family and I felt like a dinner. We had a hard look and then we ended up at this place. They served food and drinks efficiently. I ordered tagliatelle which was good and not crazy rich. Another person in my party ordered the roast chicken with vegetables the chicken was moist and there was a delicious sauce with a great variety of vegetables.  
Our party also order puttanesca which was also delicious but you need to be careful of the olives which have the pits inside. The staff were also nice. I can't wait to come to this restaurant again.
author: Will D.

description: Ugh, I hate to be the one writing the average review but here it goes. I was treating a girl friend out to a birthday dinner and she said she wanted to  have Italian. Long story short- her boyfriend doesn't take her out for Italian because he thinks it's a waste of money to spend that much on "just noodles." She knows I love Italian and that I'm always down for pasta so I told her I'd Yelp somewhere good to try. Sadly to say I wasted her one pasta outing in almost half a year on mediocre pasta. I could tell as soon as the pasta hit her lips that she was disappointed and me being a pasta lover of just jar sauce and spaghetti was also disappointed. I felt my sauce was a little too watery and it didn't stay on the pasta well. I didn't finish the pasta and didn't even bother taking it to go (that's the first for me). So odd because initially I just picked this off Yelp and thought I've never been here but when I showed up I realized I have been here years ago and I don't remember if it was good or bad then either - not a great sign. Anyways, I'm lovingggg Nostra as of now for my go to pasta place. A tad more expensive but very, very delicious.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
So this review is more of a 3.5 stars. I had made dinner reservations the day of and had to change it a few times due to unforseen circumstances. So I was very thankful that they were still able to accomodate us! After checking in with the host, we were immediately led to our table, which was at the back of the restaurant. It was actually really nice because there were real grape vines hung on the ceiling and the patio area had a certain atmosphere to it. 

Each table gets bread and olive oil and you can ask for the balsalmic vinegar too if you like to dip that with your bread. Anyways we each ordered a pasta dish. When everyone's dishes arrived, I was surprised that the pasta dishes were smaller than anticipated. My chicken pasta dish was pretty good and creamy. The wide egg noodles in there were interesting but was tasty with the sauce. My dish definetely tasted good but the flavors just didn't impress me too much. Also, my family and I didn't feel completely full after our meal and I usually get pretty full when eating pasta dishes! So for the price and how much they give you, I feel like it wasn't quite worth it. But the service here is great and sitting in the patio was awesome! I saw other tables ordering pizzas, which looked really good! So the next time I come here, I think Ill try their pizzas instead.
author: Mary C.

description:
We went for dinner with another couple on a Saturday night. We had a reservation and were seated right away. Pane E Vino is a super cute restaurant, very busy with a fun atmosphere, but the food is average and the service is atrocious. Definitely bring your own wine, the wine by the glass selection is minimal and corkage is only $20. I started with a glass of Pinot Grigio, as other Yelpers say, it's was a healthy pour but it was quite possibly the worst Pinot Grigio I have ever tasted, and it's hard to mess up Pinot Grigio. 
I ordered the Fried baby artichokes to start from the specials menu, they were actually pretty good but not what I expected. Instead of fried quarters of artichoke hearts that you normally see, it was sliced and fried fresh baby artichokes. So I ended up with a lot of leafy parts and not much of the meaty artichoke heart, but again, I enjoyed it. I decided to splurge and get the Lamb entree. It was just okay. The lamb was cooked nicely and the sauce it came with was decent but the dish just wasn't that flavorful. It cost $38. 
My husband got the gnocchi which was just weird. It was a dish of sliced gnocchi with the sauce served on the side. He said it tasted like pan fried mashed potatoes. We looked up the dish later on the Internet and apparently it's a specific type of gnocchi dish that is supposed to be that way, it would have been nice if the waiter told us, but he was too busy not caring.
I had the tiramisu for dessert and it wasn't very good, it tasted premade and seemed to be missing an ingredient (maybe the liqueur?) 
The worst part was the service, if we weren't out with friends enjoying thier company we would have been even more annoyed with our waiter who literally never came to our table. He even brought my husband the wrong beer. He never poured our wine that we brought to we just poured it ourselves. Other Yelpers talk about the bread and olive oil, I wouldn't know because we ran out of olive oil and he never replenished it ever though I asked.
Redeeming qualities include that the host was very friendly, fun atmosphere, and our friends knew one of the waiters, he seemed nice, if we had only been seated in his section this review may have been a lot different! Oh, and I didn't wake up with a migraine this morning so they must not use MSG, that is a plus!
author: Holly L.

description:
Everything is just great. At this point I can say I'm a regular. Every time I come here for dinner I order a different thing and I have never been disappointed.
Bruno is an amazing chef. 
If it's your first time here I would order something from the "day specials". Leave some space for dessert though.
I will keep coming back for more :)
author: Maggie J.

description: Thank you for a lovely meal! Service was excellent, food was delish (esp. the duck ragu, calamari, margherita pizza and affogato!) and outdoor seating was perfect for our family with young kids. Parking was perfect - could easily park on the street with metered parking. We would highly recommend this place!
author: Tricia M.

description:
I met Bruno for the first time today and he showed me the secret to his homemade fresh pasta that he was making. Exactly the way I used to remember New York when the chef used to take you for a tour through the back kitchen without you even having to ask him . I had a great meal to say the least. Two thumbs up. f.y.i request a reservation in the back atrium - Bruno's words - its the best kept secret in town. Nice setting, great for a smart but casual night out, or a romantic evening in back underneath the real clusters of grapes overhead.

Thank you so much for a great dining experience.

- rich and Isabel and Chloe
author: Rich S.

description: I have been so many times and this is Union's hidden gem. Personal faves: Carpaccio, gnocchi, pappardelle (!!!!) , and zeppole! Attentive staff,   Homemade delicious pastas and sauces, great wine.
author: Sarah P.

description: What a great local place! Friendly, attentive service, tasty food and nice wine at a good value.
author: Cathleen T.

description:
Great neighborhood spot with great service and a homey feel. I live a few blocks down and appreciate that they have the same regulars and make people feel like they're at home. Many of them also speak Italian which is neat. 

What we've had: 
Calamari - a bit pricey at $17.95 but always a good starter. The marinara is served warm and it's fried just right. 
Pappardelle- I love that it's freshly made and the chicken is moist pulled chicken and not dry chicken breast. It's surprisingly light too. 
Pennete with pancetta in a light tomato cream sauce. Cream sauce is great and not too creamy, flavor is excellent 
Tiramisu - light, flavorful, and a wonderful way to end the meal
author: Zara H.

description: Walk in Friday night ...we sat at the bar across from front kitchen ...Generous glasses of excellent red merlot ...duck breast hearty and delicious with perfect roast potatoes ... chicken good but just a little dry... and excellent generous portion house salad . Atmosphere is relaxed not too noisy, staff authentically cheerful,  and clientele local... Getting the check a little slow. A very enjoyable experience and will return.
author: Robert B.

description: We felt like we were in Italy!  Relaxed  atmosphere with delicious Italian entrees.  Casual, charming.....a great place for a relaxed date night!
author: J R.

description: This was my 1st time here.  The art on the wall is creative and eye pleasing.  The staff is attentive. The owner is warm, friendly and makes you feel at home. The duck is to die for.  The sparkling red Italian wine was tasty! I could have drank the whole bottle. I'm coming back here again.  I'd make reservations though.  My boyfriend and I were lucky to get a table with no reservations. It was packed!
author: Geraldine S.

description:
Visiting San Fran with family - 3 teen boys and husband.  Picked close to hotel and recommendations from Yelp.  Overall tasty food, filled and mainly locals.  I had a special homemade papadelle with wild mushroom black truffle cream sauce.  Wanted to lick my bowl.  The four cheese pasta on the regular menu  with smoked mozzarella and three other cheeses was incredible.  One sone ordered a special ravioli which he lived. A margarita pizza - bit if a soggy crust but devoured. My husband had the beef rigatoni which was meh - hence the 4 stars.  Waiter was friendly and a bit busy.  Ended with the BEST cheesecake we have ever tasted - usually too dessert pick so we have tried lots.  I had profiteroles - they were fine but envious of the cheesecakes my family was eating.        
They bring crusty delicious bread with olive oil when you sit down.  Dine here maybe stay away from the pasta with red sauce.
author: Moab E.

description:
Pane e Vino is an excellent, small, 'neighborhood gem' of an Italian restaurant.  I have been a fan of this restaurant since it was called Via Vai, and I eat here either take-our or dine-in basically monthly, sometimes more often.

The menu is extensive, and while there are great items on it- some of the BEST items are their nightly specials.  Always inquire about these before making up your mind.  They can fax the list to you if needed- helpful when you do a lot of take-out like us.  One of the greatest things about take out from Pane e Vino is their very responsible packaging- no messes- they are fortified in armor and the food looks great when you arrive home and it's ready to go!  Plus they always throw in bread and butter!

My favorite regular item on the menu is the calzone- really the best I have had.  Right now, they are being made with two types of cheese, ham, and delicious heirloom tomatoes.  Marinara sauce comes on the side.  Love it!  Their soups are delicious, great bruschetta appetizer, great pastas, and a wonderful raspberry tart for dessert!

After just one meal, you will surely become a fan of Pane e Vino.  Reservations are helpful but not always critical- however the place is not so big and can fill up quickly.  Although the style is not precisely the same, it compares favorably to Capannina, Ristorante Milano, Mint 54, just to name a few. I'm sure you will enjoy this place just as much as I do!
author: Andy S.

description:
Very nice, classy atmosphere and professional staff.  High end dining experience at a reasonable cost.

Starter salad and burrata cheese and tomato caprese salad were both fresh and delicious.  Chicken piccata and capellini pomodoro pasta were good, but not out of this world.

Great for a date, walking distance to nightlife.
author: Ty S.

description:
I have been wanting to come here since I moved to the area last April. We finally came and LOVED it!

The staff was super welcoming and friendly. We ordered 2 pizzas to split between 4 of us, as well as calamari and a starter salad. All was amazing, especially the pizzas. Would love to come back and try a pasta as well!
author: Alexandra W.

description: We were sadly not happy with our dinner here.  The bolognese was sugary and the noodles were soggy -- we've had much better at Jackson Fillmore or Trattoria Contadina.  The sand dabs were served on the bone, which seemed odd.  We order this dish often and it was disappointing.  I had the cream-based truffle sauce with mushrooms, it was okay.  I actually saw a friend there that evening and she was actually disappointed with the food as well...  On a positive note, the bread they served before the meal was delicious and the wine pours were very healthy.  But, I don't think we will return to Pane E Vino.
author: Tami S.

description: Once again, we had such a wonderful meal. Everything we had was made in house. Great pastas, of which my favorite was the PAPPARDELLE ALLA CONTADINA. Delightfully fresh. I'm also a big fan of their carpaccio. They also have a very reasonable wine selection. All in all, we had a wonderful evening with consistently great service. Dulce's were heavenly. Located in a quaint neighborhood in the not so busy part of San Francisco called Cow Hallow. My suggestion is to use Uber or another on demand taxi service if you are not driving for your trip home. Not the easiest place to hail a taxis thanks again to Carlos for keeping this such a fun place to dine.
author: John H.

description:
I'll start out by saying that I'm from an Italian family and have relatives who run a family restaurant in Italy. So - my expectations for Italian food might be unreasonably high, but take that as you wish. 
Overall - this place was good. Not great, but definitely good! I picked it mainly because it was more reasonably priced than other similar spots in the area. Authentic Italian style menu, listing appetizers, primi piatti (pasta dishes) and secondi piatti (main dishes). 
My friend and I both ordered pasta dishes which were both very good, but the actual pasta (I had angel hair) did not taste like it was made fresh. It tasted like box pasta. Which is fine, but if I'm going to pay to eat Italian food out, I want homemade pasta. 
I may go back at some point because it's so close to my place, but overall, if I am craving quality Italian I may look elsewhere.
author: Catherine M.

description:
Great service
Delicious meals, true italian cuisine 
Bear in mind: the pasta courses are not very large plates as pasta is considered a starter in italian cuisine, not a main dish. 
We had pasta and pizza, both great!
author: Santiago R.

description: I've travelled all across Italy several different times , and Italian food is my favorite.  This restaurant is my favorite Italian restaurant in the States.  It's just so, so good.  Weekends tend to fill up, but take out is just as delicious.  Desserts are heavenly as well!
author: Jenny B.

description:
I've been here twice in the last year, and it's been a great experience both times. The first time, it was a large group of us - maybe 10 family members, and we ordered a ton of items off the menu. It's a great place to order family style and have a taste of the pastas, anti-pastas and entrees. 

Service: 5 stars. They're helpful about the menu, super friendly and there's no pressure to rush through your meal. If you're vegetarian, they'll walk you through the menu and create vegetarian alternatives for some of the dishes that include meat. 

Ambiance: 5 stars. The back sunroom, is a great private room for a large party, and the main room in the front is cozy and comfortable. Great for large groups, or small parties. You can make reservations easily online. 

Food: 5 stars. The eggplan parmigiana is delicious! Not too salty, perfectly cheesy and simply delicious. The Italian sausage and lamb chops were juicy and perfectly seasoned. The dessert is wonderful too - try the flan or the fruit tart! Yummm
author: Neesh B.

description: Our friend, a local, introduced us to this restaurant. Certainly packed on a Saturday night but the owner accommodated us graciously. The food was absolutely delicious and the cheesecake was the best I've ever had. I would return in a heartbeat!
author: Sunny H.

description:
Loved every bit. Very cute and homely! Traditional Italian - and they have gluten free pasta! 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Stan T.

description: Authentic Italian food with authentic Italian servers haha. Good location. Make reservations because this place is small and gets packed!! I will definitely come back
author: Glenda G.

description:
Every one and place has an off night and last night was to our way of thinking a bad night for Pane e Vino.

The chicken I ate was 8 minutes from dry and that means it was far from sublime.

Similarly, the "medium rare" preparation of my wife's salmon as promised (warned as if, is that okay?) by waiter was, well, dry. It was over cooked and a piece of salmon is a terrible thing to waste.

Finally, the vegetable melange served with our main plates was over cooked in too much butter.

The front of house staff are warm, cheery and bright as one would expect at an Italian restaurant. And they're being let down by their kitchen.

Not a great night for us and Pane e Vino.
author: Jay D.

description: YUM! Great food and ambiance!  Authentic cuisine.  Try the pizzas!!!!
author: Melissa B.

description: Disappointing - definitely not a 4-star experience in this price range and in this town. Came here for dinner with a friend and was pretty underwhelmed by both the food and the wine. We sampled 3 items from the menu - the burrata appetizer, the mushroom pizza, and the fettuccine - and 2 wines. It all tasted a lot closer to what you'd get at Pasta! than what you'd get a similarly priced Italian restaurants in San Francisco - I'm talking of Delfina Pizza, Uva Enoteca, A16, Montesacro Pinseria, Gialina's etc.
author: Ruben K.

description: We were pleased to get a table for two on short notice on a Friday night. Once seated we experienced the Good, the Bad and the Ugly. The Good was represented by the timely service and the tasty Bresaola Con Rucola antipasto and Tagliatelle Verdi Alla Bolognese. The Bad was the tasteless Siciliana pizza, especially the crust which was like a cardboard make-out-of-the-box variety. MUCH better pizza can be found at Delarosa, Delfina, Rose's Cafe and A-16. We found the service staff to be Ugly as they were extremely fast and abrupt, dropping dishes on the table or asking questions so fast and departing before we had any chance to react. The emphasis in the restaurant seemed to be on speed and moving customers through rather than on a slowly paced enjoyable meal experience. We hadn't been to this restaurant for a long time and will not return again for a long time.
author: Michael B.

description:
Always a warm welcome.
A reservation is a good idea, typically they're busy but go out of their way to accommodate where possible.
I'm a repeat customer.
Ciao bello!
:D
author: John W.

description: I loved the calzone so much i want to come back again and I liked the cake a lot!    -Cruz age 8
author: Alicia T.

description: Went with 4 friends and we all enjoyed our dinners (we all got different pastas).  Atmosphere was nice (we got a table in the back, which we loved) and our server was friendly and knowledgeable (albeit a little slow sometimes).
author: JJ M.

description:
Came here for a quick dinner after a haircut with my Fiance!

I actually used to live 2 blocks away but never went it! We made a quick reservation, thanks to yelp/open table and grabbed a spot in the packed house on a wednesday night. 

The server and staff was very attentive and very italian. 

Ordered a great 1/2 bottle of Malbec ($18) and a Caprese salad to share. 

I ordered the flat chicken with tomatoes (lacking flavor but I was trying to be healthy) and my fiancé ordered the veal, excellent. 

Our dinner was under $100 and we had a great little date night. 

I would definitely recommend if you're looking for authentic food. GO FOR THE PASTA!!!
author: Heather H.

description: Love this restaurant and Bruno, the owner and chef!! Come here often with friends and always have a great time.
author: Didi S.

description:
Very surprised by all the 4 and 5 star ratings.

Service was prompt, polite, attentive to my water glass, but not very helpful or chatty. Which is a-ok. 

Ordered a grilled raddichio wrapped in proscuitto appetizer, bucatini all'amatriciana, the pappardelle with chicken and mushrooms, and the tiramisu. 

The appetizer was probably the most unique thing we got, which was just an italian twist on bacon wrapped asparagus. As for the pastas and the dessert, all were painfully average and lacked flavor. I've definitely had better of all three. Though it should be noted that the texture of the pappardelle was quite good. 

An okay place, but won't be coming back as there are tons of better italian places in North Beach.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
This is the BEST Italian Food I've had in San Francisco.  Considering its two blocks away from our apartment, we go approximately twice per month, and have become regulars.

What I find humorous about some bad reviews that people have left placed on yelp is of the service.  Let me fill these people in on a little secret...when a restaurant is busy they don't usually have time to coddle you like a 4 year old.  The service is fine.  They may not be the most attentive, but for the most part they are knowledgeable on the food and wine.  The staff is mostly form northern Italy, and if you've ever been to Italy you will know the personality of Italiano's.  So I understand if the personality rubs San Franciscans the wrong way.  However, as an aside, once you become a regular, they treat you like gold. Also, if you attempt to speak Italian when ordering, they appreciate that as well.

As for the food: I've had mostly everything there. My rule of thumb is "order whatever pasta is handmade:

1.  My wife usually orders the Truffle Pasta, and loves it.  Its the fan favorite.  The Pasta is handmade.  Also a vegetarian option.
2.  Any pizza is great. Thin crust, fresh sauce.  I recommend the Mushroom and Prosciutto 
3.  The Gnocchi is handmade and incredible with any sauce
4.  The wild boar pasta with pappardelle is my personal favorite
5.  The Veal Steak is very good.  Has a lot of rosemary and fresh veggies
6.  Calamari appi is ok but I don't think I'd order it again.
7.  Bolognese is good.
8.  Cornish Game Hen is good too.
9.  House Chianti.  We usually get the house Chianti.  The first few times we went they had 2007 San Vincenti Chianti Classico which is to die for.  They then ran out and now have a 2009.  DO NOT GET THE 2009.
10.  If you prefer Chianti and they dont have the 2007 get Collefrisio Zero.  Its not as good as the 2007 but is somewhere between the 2009 and 2007.

Hope this helps.  Maybe we will see you on a random Friday at  Pan e Vino

Ciao
author: Jeremy E.

description: had the Chicken Toscana for some light fare good Italian food. Did not disappoint.  Plan to return to try the Pane E Vino Lasagna
author: Aaron F.

description: Really great place. The atmosphere had a relaxing community vibe, and the service was great. The best part was the food.. Absolutely delicious and authentic. I'm glad my friend recommended this place to me!
author: Ali R.

description: All day I was thinking about halibut and there it was in the menu. Delicious but a little over cooked. Burrata was prefect though! Service a little slow. But a sweet spot over all. I look forward to returning next trip to SF.
author: Dee F.

description:
Fantastic place for a date, drinks with friends or a business meeting.

Bruno is warm and friendly to diners and you feel very much at home on the first visit - almost a regular.

They have bar stool seating at the back where you can watch the kitchen work on desserts, salads and pizza. Great place for a first date.

Food is amazing!
author: John G.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants.  Great spinach salad with bacon, fresh pastas such as the spinach bolognese, pizzas and the chocolate profiterole is my favorite.....
author: Molly C.

description:
Great comfortable, classic, non-pretentious but still interesting Italian food. I agree that the menu almost doubles with the daily specials which don't seem to be listed online, but there are a lot of intriguing options - we saw a couple of rabbit dishes.

We were started with a lot of excellent rustic bread - of course, an excellent sign. The olive oil was pretty light and not too flavorful, and I would have liked some balsamic vinegar to have with it, but the bread alone was superb, so that was fine. The wine list is quite extensive, but our waiter helped guide us once we had narrowed it down a bit.

We shared an order of bruschetta and an antipasto plate among 4 people, which was more than enough for everyone. The only bruschetta we saw offered was pretty plain (the classic tomato, basil, olive oil), but it was spot-on. The bread was perfectly grilled/toasted and the tomatoes were flavorful and delicious. The antipasto plate was a bit unusual to me - no cheese, various meats, and lots of vegetables and beans. I loved the peppers and both white and kidney beans, but found some of the pickled items a bit too strong. 

I had the pollo marinato allo griglia (chicken breast with tomato, basil, and garlic) because I felt like protein rather than carby pasta. I have to admit that I was expecting a rather dull dish, but it was *delicious*! The grilling was perfect so that the chicken breast was very flavorful and not at all dried out. I loved this meat, and there were also a lot of nice vegetables and a couple of small pieces of potato on the side. The only thing I would have changed would have been to have more tomato on it.

The pasta I tried was cooked perfectly. The bolognase was a serious meat sauce - I would have also preferred this with a lot more tomato! But it tasted good. I'd love to come back and try some other pasta dishes and the pizza.

I was also impressed with the dessert. The sorbet was truly outstanding - normally I feel like sorbets are substandard and thrown on a menu without care. We had three flavors (mango, raspberry, and lemon), and all were delicious - especially the lemon! There were a couple of wrapped cookies with it as well - very nice. The cheesecake was surprisingly tasty and the berries that came with it were wonderful! I also enjoyed my cappuccino. 

This is a fairly cozy spot, and I was definitely glad we had reservations on a Saturday night (there doesn't seem to be much space to wait for a table!). It was bustling, bordering on loud, but not overly so, luckily. The service was generally good, although when we arrived, we were "jokingly" interrogated for being two minutes late for our reservation. That's fine if we were long-standing customers, etc, but as a first impression for a restaurant, it was odd. We were seated promptly. Our waiter was generally very helpful and accepted a substitution with absolutely no fuss, which was great. But a couple of times we had a bit of trouble getting his attention, and he brought out one incorrect dish (but promptly corrected it). So, a little hit or miss, but overall the service was pretty good.

It seems easy to go to really high-end, expensive, fancy Italian restaurants in the city, but actually harder to find a more casual, but still nice, classic Italian restaurant. I think Pane e Vino fits the bill and I'd be happy to go back.
author: Lisa K.

description:
My wife and I took 5friends from out of the country to dinner here last night (5/24/14). At first they tried to squeeze us all into a small corner of the restaurant. But after we protested they move us to a larger table in the back. Reservations is an absolute must at this place because it is small, popular as well as a local gym.

The food was good and probably the best part of our visit. The staff was friendly but a little nonchalant when it came to service. They were slow to respond and we had to flag them down constantly. They actually got one of our appetizer orders wrong. They didn't charge us for it though. The restaurant was busy but not so busy that the staff couldn't be more attentive. Hence the 4 out of 5 as opposed to 5 stars.

In my opinion the prices are a little high for what you get. But it is San Francisco at a very popular restaurant which is well reviewed. We will probably go back but only occasionally.
author: J W.

description: Delicious food, lovely ambiance, would absolutely come here again on a special occasion / nice date night. We sat at the counter and got to chatting with the owner. He was very Italian, and he insisted that have dessert (on the house)!
author: Carly A.

description:
Authentic Italian food. My wife and I (and now our 20 month old daughter) have been eating here at least once a month for over 6 years. The food is consistent, prices very reasonable and the staff are all extremely friendly. 

All the items are standouts, but a few favorites include the sea food linguine, all of the pizza's, and the wild boar pasta.
author: Greg H.

description: This place hits on all cylinders.  Top notch Italian.  My son had gluten free pasta and even that was prepared perfectly.  I had the rabbit and it was assembled with pancetta and by a masterful hand that loves the food that they prepare.  Just a random find while on vacation and it blew me away.
author: Howard L.

description: I Live 2 blocks away and it only took 7 years for me to pop in, but I finally did and I would for sure come back. The servers were really attentive and helpful when it came to selecting a bottle of wine. He suggested a great bottle of Pinot (Barnett Vineyards) and at $49, it was a steal since after checking retails at $45, so not a crazy markup that we are accustomed to see. We shared spaghetti and a margarita pizza (with anchovies), and it was delicious. A great family run atmosphere, whether it was or not, but had that caring feeling.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Well, I gave it 5 deserved stars back in 2013! Then I went last Friday night and as I always do I sit at the counter and just want to enjoy looking at the guys cooking and say hello to Bruno and taste whatever he is making and offers me to try. I ordered the meat raviolis and they were great but my waiter was the ultimate worst!

I had never seen him before but he was extremely unattentive and it took 40 minutes to get just my raviolis! A couple came in and sat next to me way after I had arrived and they were served before me! When the plate was taken from me no one asked me if I would like desert and the bus boys were helping me not even my waiter!

Then to top it off the couple was charged for my meal! If I had not made a comment on the service they would have left paying for my meal. The attention to customers has unfortunately gone down hill. So, unfortunately I have to say good bye to another restaurant from my past that just is no longer the same.
author: Yvonne J.

description: Every meal I have ever had hear has been AMAZING!! Definite go to!!! The owner is so sweet and the staff is friendly. If you sit at the bar the owner Bruno usually will come talk to you and give you special treatment with a little extra treats!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Foreigners and immigrant beware!

Went here with my wife and father to enjoy a genuine Italian food experience. Well, the food was ok but that doesn't cover the fact that the waiter tried to steal from us.

The food and wine was acceptable, but not as good as some people have described it. I could easily name 10 better Italian resturants in SF. 

The waiter was very hospitable and friendly throughout the meal, and based on our Scandinavian and accents (we moved to SF a year ago) and his choice of topics it was obvious he thought we were tourists-just-of-the-boat.

When the check came in he had done something that I have never experiences before in the US - he had filled in the tip himself (25%) and just asked me to sign.

When I asked him what this was (first politely) he just very casually said, "Well, this is the way we do it in the US and we always do it in this resturant as a courtesy to our guest, so they do not have to worry about it". 

At this point I understood that he was playing us for major fools and actually tried to STEAL FROM US and went ballistic.

After being face with my Viking wrath for a couple of minutes he confessed that, "No, they didn't do this to all customers and no they certainly not didn't do it to their regulars" 

To add insult to injury he started to rant about how important the tip was to all their employees, and went on to call me insensitive for not understanding that he had to make a living too (Yes, he truly sounded as a cliché character from a mafia movie, I kid you not)

When I asked to speak with the owner he said he was the owner. True or not, that means that this problem is not just one lousy employee but a very rotten business practice.

I explained to him that the tip is decided by the guest and that what he just tried to do was stealing from us under a rosy disguise.

For the first time in history I actually gave 0% in tip and just wished I could have made it lower.

I would rank this as one of my worst resturant visits ever.
author: Matt G.

description:
This was a spur of the moment decision to go here and I'm so glad we did!  Food, atmosphere, service, and most importantly dessert, were impeccable and authentic.
