It's unfortunately I am only visiting San Francisco  or I would become a regular.
author: Regina S.

description: Service was pretty good.  Pasta was al dente.  Tiramisu was blend.  Not a lot of flavor and not rich enough.  Mascarpone is supposed to give that rich creamy taste.  This would be my only complaint.  Otherwise everything was good.
author: Maria B.

description:
~~~~~~ ABSOLUTELY TACTLESS ~~~~~~~

Food - excellent, service (while getting food) - great, but (!!!) when we stayed after dinner - the manager came over to ask us for a favor - and moved us to a smaller table (two of our guests left leaving the two of us at a table for four). We happily obliged. 

AND THEN - every few minutes, a waiter came over to us asking us if we would like anything else. On the fourth time (he COMPLETELY RUINED our good impression of the place) - I said: 
"LOOK, YOU ALREADY ASKED US THREE TIMES, please leave us alone and let us sip our tea, we do not want anything else!"

Then the manager comes and says: we are so sorry, we have people waiting.

LISTEN, PANE E VINO, I AM SURE YOU MADE AN EXTRA $50 for the extra 15-20 min (max) that we didn't spend at your place, but you lost me FOREVER as your formerly happy customer. And you lost people to whom I would have otherwise recommended you.

WHERE DID YOU LEARN YOUR MANNERS? 
At McDonalds??? 
Burger King???

LEARN A THING OR TWO ABOUT NOT ANNOYING YOUR CUSTOMERS (who were just so happy about your place, and would have come back)

ABSOLUTELY TACTLESS
author: Igor S.

description: Great authentic Italian food. Came here for a dinner date and left extremely satisfied. The pizza was to die for, thin crust with the perfect amount of sauce. Pretty decent wine list also.
author: Chris B.

description:
I had a mixed experience which was overall positive. It was for a friend's birthday.


The Bad:
Despite there being several waiters about, throughout the meal it was never clearly established which one was ours. Throughout the meal I resorted to asking random waiters and managers (they had at least 3 men dressed to work but not as waiters) for various things. We always ended up getting what we asked for but it made me feel awkward that I didn't know who our waiter was.

When one of the managers brought our wine, he left it on the table and walked off without opening it. 

The Good:

The wait staff were friendly and nice and did brings things relatively quickly. When they sang happy birthday to my friend I think the chef came out and joined them, and they sang in Italian with fantastic tone and  strength.  The anti-pasti tray was great and had a lot of food on it, and their bread is good.

The Mediocre:

I ordered Linguine Con Le Vongole and it was highly mediocre. I cook and can make it better than this place, which is not a good sign. It's an incredibly easy dish and was just boring.
author: Jordan C.

description:
A girlfriend and I were meeting for dinner. As we usually end up in her neighborhood, we decided to try something in mine. I'd never been and/or heard of Pane E Vino, but thought it was worth a shot.

The place is cute and quaint, and absolutely Italian. (By this I mean, the service is parallels that of Italy- SLOW.) I arrived at 7:40 (about 10 minutes late for our 7:30 reservation). My girlfriend had already been seated. It took them 30 minutes before they took our drink order. That being said, they were friendly and accommodating. 

Girlfriend ordered the Frutti de Mare pasta, and I had something off the specials menu. (Orrechette with broccoli rabe and pancetta- I added the pancetta.) The pasta was cooked to perfection, and I ate every bite. I'm not sure this was indicative to how delicious my meal was, or just how damn hungry I was since I had waited so long to eat!

All and all- a decent meal. Nothing fantastic, nothing terrible.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Great food, good house wine and decent dining area. The service was very good. I had corkscrew pasta with eggplant in tomato sauce, the best one I had in a long time. The house wine was good.

The place is a little pricier, but a perfect place for a date or a family dinner.
author: Srikanth N.

description: Excellent meal - all 3 of us had the local Sanddab fish (similar to Sole) which was one of the best fish dishes ever!  Service was very good. Waiter recommended a great wine for us which was only $40. This is a very local place so I almost (almost) hate to rate it fearing tourist will overrun it.
author: Clayton A.

description:
I have been to this location twice now. 

The first time, I went with my parents and we just walked in. We had a very nice time. I had the special of balsamic duck and spinach... Very delicious. The parentals had risotto which I think was the best out of everything. I would rate this experience as a 5. 

The second time I went with a group of 5 girls and we had made a reservation a head of time. The waiters were very rude. We were not being difficult, making ridiculous requests (we all ordered food off the menu as is), nor were we loud. It's not as we expected special attention, but the service left me feeling irritated. I would rate this experience as a 2. The food was still good, so that is why I would say 2 over a 1 star. 

Definitely mixed feelings on this place. I probably would go again to see if I had a better experience. Maybe the waiter was having a bad night. If I had the same rude service as my second time there, I will not be going here again.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this local Italian spot, however super disappointed I didn't try their tiramisu. Looks fantastico!

We dined here on a Quadruple date, which was very fun yet still intimate enough where we could all easily chat over vino and pasta. So overall, very good for groups. Everyone had a different dish; gnocchi, pizza, risotto, ravioli....and everything was delicious. The pasta is obviously homemade, light not heavy and perfectly proportioned. 

Service was good but not anything special. We will definitely be back!
author: Meredith M.

description:
I had a delicious dinner there at their bar which has four seats. This is a great place to meet some of the locals who frequent this place. The spinach pappardelle with bolognese was perfectly al dente and the sauce had great notes. The lady next to me had some delicious looking baby octopus but I didn't taste (I didn't know her but she was a regular). 

The apple tart was good but not amazing. The zabaglione sauce on the place was great with what tasted like notes of orange zest.

My favorite part of the night was meeting some nice people from the neighborhood. We had great conversations along with good food.
author: Raul H.

description:
I love this place! My favorite restaurant in San Francisco. It is a 'special occasion' place for my husband and I, only because it is a ways from us. If we lived in the city, it would be a regular destination. 

Bruno, the owner is amazing. He is an incredible chef, who creates authentic Italian meals. The rest of the wait staff is efficient and friendly also. I think the people complaining of slow staff don't get the concept of enjoying a meal. This isn't a fast food drive-thru. Everything is fresh, from the meat and fish, to vegetables and even herbs. The menu is extensive and we have tried many different meals here, and everything is spectacular. From homemade pastas, pizzas cooked in a brick oven, to daily specials. And the deserts - WOW!

There are nooks for intimate romantic dinners , and a beautiful enclosed back patio (with real grape vines!) perfect for bigger parties. Great for singles, couples, families, really any size party.

If you've never been, it's definitely worth a visit.
author: Misti D.

description:
Service is somewhat good: drinks are refilled, fresh ground pepper and other garnishes are always offered, and they are really friendly.  They also hustle like no one I've seen before, but then it also feels like they're rushing you.

The main course, however, was like waiting for the Muni bus. The digital sign at the bus stop will say arriving, but you don't see any bus approaching. Then the sign will change back to one minute.  Same thing with our main course.  It would look like the server was walking towards us with our dish, but then ("sike") drops it off to another table. 

Good flavors in my sausage and artichoke rigatoni, but rigatoni was too underdone so I couldn't even be impressed by their "homemade" pasta  So disappointed! My fiancee's chicken was really dry and somewhat bland.  

Slow service thinly veiled by waiters walking fast coupled with expensive, underdone/dry food is annoying. I probably won't be back.
author: Dorothy N.

description: I hosted a large party for my husbands birthday.  They were super accommodating.  They didn't charge us corkage and everyone enjoyed the food.  Be aware though that they only allow two credit card per table.
author: Yana K.

description: Pan E Vino is my favorite local restaurant. Whenever I need my comfort food, either eating in or take out, I go there.  My favorite dish is Melanzane Fusilli. The food tastes as good as eating in Italy! The waiters and staff are always sweet and welcoming. They offer nice wines with healthy servings.
author: Sandra A.

description:
Complimentary bread is always a great start for dinner. My dear cousins and I ordered two appetizers: calamari and rare beef+cheese (refer to pix).

The calamari was very lightly breaded. It lacked the fried crispy texture, and it was very bland. Even the lemon and side sauce couldn't save it.
The rare beef with cheese was the exact concept of the Vietnamese rare beef. The beef was thinly sliced and there was cheese on top. 

I ordered the salmon and shrimp in a garlic mushroom sauce. For $18 and it was on the special menu, it didn't "wow" me. Don't get me wrong, I love how they emphasized the garlic in this meal, but nothing really got my attention for this dish. I wouldn't crave for this dish at all. 

One of the other dishes that was ordered was this clam and mussel dish. The mussel still reeked from the Ocean =( stay away!

Another dish was the wild mushroom truffle. My cousin kept insisting how awesome it was. I admit that was good for a dish with NO MEAT, but for $20, I'll pass. It's a great dish for mushroom lovers. It's creamy.

For our last dish, I don't even remember what it was. I remember that I tried it, but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. It had something with chicken and tomato sauce. 

Service was great though! Food was okay.
author: Sandy T.

description:
We came in late after a tradeshow. We had a big table, so we shared some of the dishes. It was delicious. 

Really quick:
The wine was tasty. We all shared a bottle.
The caprese salad was beautiful. 
The calamari was ok. I have had better. (and worse!)
The mushroom pasta was yummy.
The veggie pizza was good. I liked that they added eggplant for a more meatier taste, but I like a more crunchy, cruchy crust.
I didn't try the sausage pizza or the spaghetti, because it was at the other end of the table, but they said it was really good.

All in all, it was really filling and just what I needed after being at a tradeshow all day.

I would go there again if I wanted a local place in the city. Truthfully, I also like the mushroom pasta at Donato Enoteca and it is closer to my Redwood City apartment.
author: Samantha E.

description:
Honestly was not impressed.  Came here with a few folks after a rock climbing excursion.

What stood out the most was the kindness of the owner/manager(?) there.  Guy with the vest.  He was SUPER sweet and very kind... for that they get a star.  The other star goes to the GIGANTIUM pizza!  Looked very good, unfortunately it's not what I ordered... boo.

Caprese salad was yummy, but pretty hard to jack that up.  Proscuitto wrapped asparagus, also yummy, but also hard to screw up.  For my meal I had the truffle pasta.  It was OK, maybe they use summer truffles?  I don't know too much about that, just know the flavor was not pronounced enough for me to write home about.

Ok, second time we've gone to an Italian joint and bf ordered the rib eye.  He's not a pasta guy so when we go Italian, he gets something meaty.  Huge disappointment.  Meat itself was just ok, totally lacked any flavor, even for a rib eye.  Even if you just LIGHTLY salt a rib eye before grilling it, it can come out flavorful and juicy... not here.

Dessert was the chocolate covered gelato puffs... simple and good, but when you've had the chocolate sauce at Buca, it's hard to impress me with anything but.

Ok, now the service... ECK... we were here for three hours and we didn't even have wine, nor did we linger.  The tables around us clearly were served before us.  Granted there were six of us, but I still don't expect it to be delayed THAT much.

Unfortunately not a place we will be back to.  Oh well, onto the next...
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I'd highly recommend this place for large event gatherings.  I spent my New Year's eve dinner in a party of 15 (somewhat intoxicated young adults), and was quite impressed.

The restaurant itself was really dressed up for the event, with party favors on the tables, and balloons hanging from the ceiling.  Nice.

The service was absolutely impeccable.  Our waiter came back countless times to check and refill our wine and water glasses, put up with our bad jokes, and was extremely helpful with payment.

Food's okay.  I ordered wheat noodles and duck ragout which was quite enjoyable.  Nothing special, but given everything else I was quite satisfied.

The big surprise was the check -- dinner, drinks, for 15 people? $35 a person!  Including tax and tip!  Unbelievable.

Anyway, good times here on New Year's.  If I had to organize an event in the Marina next year, I'd definitely check here.
author: Bill H.

description:
Excellent little restaurant, the interior is decorated well, the bar has a TV, there's a cool little wine area and the seating is filled with booths and tables.  The service was really good and attentive.  

I really enjoyed one of their house specials, the veal shank with saffron risotto.  The veal was very tender almost like oxtail.  The risotto was well cooked but I wish there was more flavor, or maybe they could make it with some cheese or something.

We also had calamari and pizza with prosciutto for our appetizers, the pizza was good, thin crust with fresh ingredients.

I would recommend this place for some good Italian food.
author: Kevin W.

description: Had a wonderfully relaxing dinner with the family. The service was incredible, and so accommodating in every way. Seated us an hour early and very welcoming like we were family. It felt like the restaurants we visited in Florence. The Pappardelle with mushrooms and sausage was delicious, olive oil for the bread was extremely flavorful.  The Mille dessert  and cappuccino was yummy. The environment is lively but not rushed. Can't wait to go back!
author: Karen S.

description:
"He enjoyed the Meal".   For a tough customer like my Dad,  that is high praise.
Stumbling upon this place as the dinner options were closing, we were pleasantly surprised to find a great selection of well crafted Italian dishes to eat.
author: Jeff S.

description: I love this place !!! Their service is excellent ! And so is their food! Specially their pizza!! I gotta say this is one of the best Italians restaurants I've tried so far. I definitely recommend it.
author: Berlin M.

description: We love love love this place! Every time we visit San Francisco we have to come here for at least one meal. My husband is Italian, so we rarely ever go to Italian restaurants, he's too picky plus he's a good cook. Anyway, we love the pizza and have tried most of the pastas and they're all good. The tiramisu is amazing too! Almost as important as the food, the service is amazing. We go every 1 1/2 to 2 years and they treat us like regulars. It's good Italian food without being fussy.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Delicious! 

My family is very sceptical when we go out expecially for italian because we have had more crappy meals than good. I hate to spend money on an average meal when I can make it myself, better. I am an italian cook and a damn good one (if I may say).
 
This restaurant was outstanding! We had a few different pasta dishes and shared them. We all loved out meals. I had the pasta with pancetta and mushrooms, my daughter had the spinach fettuchini with bolognese, my dad had the veal scallopini, my mom the risotto with asparagus and rock shrimp and my husband had the angel hair pasta with tomatoes.

For dessert we had the profiteroles, apple strudel and the puffed pastry with fresh berries and cream ( my favorite).

We went on a Thursday for a 7:30 reservation and were leaving at about 9. The place was still packing in the people. You know that's always a sign of a great restaurant!
author: Kara K.

description:
Great service and really good food. 
The staff is very nice and accommodating. I wanted a risotto that was not on the menu and they just whipped it up! It was exactly what I wanted. 
The small seating area makes for a very enjoyable and personalized experience. 
We will sure come back here!
author: Patricia B.

description:
After hearing about this place and its great reviews by a friend, I decided to try it out since I was up in the city this past weekend.

All I can say is wow!  The food was wonderful.  Great people.  Nice ambiance.  Everyone was very welcoming.  The wine was delicious!  I can tell you that out of the 2 entrees, 2 apps and dessert, there was nothing bad!  The portions are good size as well!!!

Its a little small but I think it makes it more intimate!

Cant wait to go back and try more things!
author: Melissa P.

description:
I've been here twice so far, and both times had similar experience:  excellent food, bad service.  I really like their Penne Alla Puttanesca (tomato sauce, capers, olives, and anchovies) and their special pasta with truffle sauce and shaved truffles was excellent.  Their pizzas are pretty good too.  The problem is that the service is just bad.  Even though the food comes out quickly after you order it, the wait staff are very slow and basically disregard their customers until you waive them down.  Each time we were there, we had to get the manager's attention, who then chased down our waiter, just to place our order and also to let them know we were finished eating.

With all that being said, I would go back again because the food is good and the prices are reasonable.  Just don't go on a night when you are in a rush or have something planned for after dinner.  Don't expect a fine dining experience either.
author: Ghaz M.

description: Came here for my sisters birthday last week. Fabulous Italian food. They give you very tasty bread and oil to nibble on while you wait. We had the salad as an appetizer and it was really good. Also had some mozzarella cheese thing with some pita bread. For the main course we had the ravioli which was very rich and tasty. The sausage pizza was also fabulous. We left with our stomachs full for sure. The wait staff was amazing! They sang happy birthday to my sister in Italian and let us cut our cake there. Very nice place and great atmosphere. Will return!
author: Scott B.

description:
Love love love their food & the front dining room is cozy & good for a romantic date. 

If they try to lead you back to the anterior "patio" (or whatever they call this terrible, dirty space) run like a rabbit. The space is akin to a patio in some suburb in a city that died long ago with no ambiance whatsoever. If you then feel like you've been relegated to Outer Siberia, well rabbit, you have.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
This is the best Italian restaurant I have been to in San Francisco.  I'd call it a hidden gem, as I had to walk by it many times before deciding to go inside.  (I should have been clued in by the fact that it is almost always packed.)  

The food is authentic Italian.  I highly recommend the pasta bolognese.  The service is good.  Maybe a 4.5/5, as occasionally some of that chauvinistic Italian attitude comes out, but it is never too brusque in my opinion.  If you haven't been here, you need to try it - it may become your favorite neighborhood Italian.
author: Evan B.

description:
Very average Italian food. 
* The rav special lacked flavor. 
* The pizza was just meh (go to Delfina for good thin crust pizza)

As an FYI - just because you are yelling at your staff in a language I don't speak doesn't mean I don't pick up on the negativity.

Probably would not return
author: Captain B.

description: There is nothing like a small homey Italian restaurant with real Italian waiters. Good menu and wine list to compliment your meal. We ordered antipasto, pizza, wine, coffee and dessert...Excellent.
author: SJ O.

description: I was very excited to return to Pane E Vino last night after having an enjoyable meal here last year. Unfortunately, my return yesterday proved to be one of the worst service experiences. We ordered two salads, a pasta and salmon. The food was all very good with the exception of the salmon. The piece of salmon was gritty and fatty throughout. We shared the feedback with our server and he literally grabbed the salmon from the table and said - this is how our salmon is served.  I explained that I imagined I would enjoy the salmon, but this piece wasn't up to par. Instead of empathizing he walked away and never returned ... we were then approached by a new server who apologized and said that our server was no longer working ... such a strange situation and quite honestly ruined our meal.
author: Jacqueline G.

description: Service, ambiance and food is always wonderful. I've been going to Pane e Vino since 1991 and have enjoyed every calorie consumed - probably eaten here over a 100+ times.  Best stuffed artichoke - bar none. If I would to change or suggest anything it would be to add some new sorbet flavors.
author: Diane P.

description:
In town for a 2-day respite from Silicon Valley, I came with my husband and 8 yr old for what turned out to be the best meal the three of us may ever have had!  The fusilli with smoked mozzarella and eggplant was amazingly flavorful.  The pizza was just right- excellent sauce and perfectly made thin crust.  The house wine was okay, but desserts more than made up for that- especially the homemade cheesecake.  

Our waiter was wonderful and the atmosphere of the place was just what we were looking for: nice but not too snooty, lots of character, family friendly.  We will definitely be back again!
author: Joan L.

description: Authentic Italian in a rustic, homey vibe. Great family or friend spot. Not for a first date. Food is excellent. Pastas are homemade - had the mushroom truffle oil linguine last night. Shared that, sea bass, and a spinach and pear salad, one glass of chianti and we were out of there at 42 per person including tax and tip.
author: Christina N.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here a few months ago - sorry it took so long to review!

I had the pappardelle with a light cream sauce and it was AMAZING! I cant remember what the bf had as his main course, but we shared the artichoke salad. Good, but kind of hard to eat.

My best friend's gf had the mushroom pizza and since they were going to the Fillmore after dinner, I took it home - it was even better the next day! 

I would absolutely eat here again, as it is nearly three months later and I still dream about that pasta. Highly recommended :)
author: Kate R.

description:
I came on a Friday night to grab dinner with the boy and a couple friends. We called ahead of time and were able to put our name on the list for a table, which was really convenient.

We started with the insalata pane e vino (mixed greens w/ parmesan cheese, croutons and vinaigrette) which was refreshing.  Nothing special, but something nice to start off with.

The menu here is pretty extensive so there's something for everyone.  After debating between ordering off the regular menu vs. the specials menu, I eventually decided to go with the osso buco dish off the special menu.  The osso buco came served with a saffron risotto, and (with the boy) I ate almost the entire plate.  The meat was very tender and had good flavor, and the risotto was also prepared expertly.  It really was a large portion of food, but it was so good we ate til we were past full.

The boy ordered another special dish: penne with smoked salmon and caviar in a vodka cream sauce.  The dish was really good but the smokiness of the salmon was a bit strong.  I only had a few bites of it (mostly because the boy enjoyed it so much it was going pretty quickly) but I thought that was enough.  I probably wouldn't have been able to eat the whole dish.

One friend ordered a spaghetti with tuna roe and clams, on which we really weren't sure if there was actual tuna roe on it, but our friend nearly finished his plate too.  Our last friend ordered the guazzeto di pesce (clams, mussels, shrimp, and calamari in a tomato broth) off the appetizer menu, but it was plenty big for an entree for one.  She also said it was really tasty.

The service here seemed a little distracted, though I suppose I would also lose interest in a table that hadn't really decided on food or drinks after "browsing" the menu for several minutes.  

All-in-all, I really enjoyed pane e vino, and because of the wide selection of dishes  I can see myself coming back for more.
author: Naoko M.

description: Great authentic Italian food! We went for valentines day and the restaurant was bright and not exactly "romantic" but the service was good and the food was delicious! Great neighborhood spot.
author: Erin H.

description: One of the most amazing meals of my life. Especially, the best Italian restaurant in the marina/cow hollow. Extremely romantic and cozy with a wood burning pizza oven and quaint decor. We had the cured meats (salumi), striped bass and grilled veal chop. Literally, melts in your mouth with the perfect seasonings. For dessert lemon cello, chocolate terrine, and Lambrusco. Go there. You will thank me.
author: Lisa F.

description:
I just had the biggest lunch in the history of mankind. I ate so much I cannot even move. I feel and probably look like Jabba the Hut during the middle of his "heavy" phase.

So what I do to help remedy all this? I write a review about food.

This past Saturday my niece put together an impromptu surprise birthday dinner for my sister.  We needed some place that accommodate five and offer vegetarian dishes (no seafood or chicken etc) and still have plenty of carnivore offerings and provide a fun and lively atmosphere.

Enter Pan E Vino

We arrived at 8:30 and were quickly ushered to our table. Our waiter took drink orders and were sitting in front of us within just a few minutes. Our waiter took awesome care of us and never once did we feel neglected. Our starters were brought out within a decent amount of time and the spacing between that and our mains was perfect.

At the end of the night, four desserts were carried out by four different waiters who sang "Happy Birthday" in Italian. At least I believe it was Happy Birthday? My Italian these days is not so bueno.

All in all, a perfect evening and the perfect restaurant for us.
author: Rene C.

description: Loved this place, the service was great, the food was perfectly portioned and delicious. It also was reasonably priced. This is my new go to neighborhood Italian restaurant for sure.
author: Amy S.

description: We had a great experience here for dinner.  Very busy considering it was a Monday.   We were here with kids and mother in law, and service was good, food was good (recommend the linguine tutto mare and the Veal my husband had)
author: christina o.

description:
I find myself in the Marina with my visitor friend craving Italian food after her pedicure. For whatever reason I realize I have been to all Italian restaurants in the Marina.....although I live in North Beach. And I also realize that when I want good and reliable non-fancy Italian, I go to Pane E Vino. And it never disappoints me.

We walked by many empty restaurants on a foggy Sunday evening, but Pane E Vino was busy as usual. It took us 15 minutes to get a table. The warm ambiance and the festive atmosphere made it a great place to have a cozy catch up with my friend. 

We had the fresh burratta with heirloom tomatoes and anchovies for starters. It was one of the daily specials, and I never had it there before. I went to heaven! If you are ever there when they have it on the specials menu, GET IT! Our neighbors were jealous too!

My friend had the ravioli with spinach and prosciutto, while I had the pizza marguerita. They were both really good. What is even more extraordinary about this place is the price - $10 for such an amazing gourmet appetizer?? $12.50 for that huge and yummy pizza?? 

The wine list is relatively good too, and after a couple of glasses of malbec, a super comforting meal and a lot of catching up, we were both ready to wrap up our weekend. We were thankful. Thankful for life, thankful for Italians and thankful for Pane E Vino.
author: Simone W.

description:
Wait staff and manager were very friendly and attentive.  My dish was good, but not great.  Lots of specials, and I suspect if I had an opportunities to try a few more items I'd find some real gems. 

They gave us as much bread and zesty olive oil as we desired, which I certainly enjoyed.  I'd recommend they add some balsamic vinegar to the mix.
author: Jordan B.

description: We were looking for a hidden gem and found it.  Using yelp, we felt this was a good place to try. WOW, what a great find.  Atmosphere is warm and inviting and reminiscent of a true restaurant in Rome. Food was simply amazing.  We split a salad and had the ravioli and corkscrew pasta. Both were amazing. The ravioli a were obviously homemade and cooked perfectly. We had to share a dessert because we were so full.  We chose the profiteroles and they were amazing.  Also in a nice part of town with plenty of boutique type shops up and down Union Street. You can tell it is really good because almost all the customers are regulars and locals.  The staff knew just about everyone.  And by the way, the staff is super on top of their game.  Super service!
author: Rob J.

description: Love this spot!!! We come on the regular because the food is delicious and fresh! My staple is the fish and veggies and couldn't be more satisfied!
author: Melissa R.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in all of SF. I've lived here for almost 5 years and have been to many Italian spots. Maybe there is a bit of bias because it's just a few blocks from where i live, but the food is amazing. The risotto is a must have and any pizza you order will be so tasty. This place is very popular with the locals, even I've become a regular. It's always busy, so make sure to make a reservation.
author: Fabiola S.

description: Stumbled across this place by fluke. Was amazing. We got there just before the rush, it gets busy on a Wednesday night! We were served two lots of bread while waiting - best bread I've had in SF. The house red wine was delicious, no Corona but they do have Heineken. The food came out fast (because we beat the rush I assume), the pizza had a delicious sauce, it looked boring but tasted great. The salmon was simple, cooked well through with veges being brocolli and carrots lightly tossed in olive oil. Service was fantastic, they all appeared to be Itallians (with their accents) and one waiter loved to chat to us, so stopped at our table a couple times in passing - probably because of OUR accents :p
author: Sarna B.

description: Forgettable. The pappardelle with duck ragu seriously smelled and tasted like chef boyarde but they nicely offered to replace it with a eggplant cheese tomato pasta dish.. Much better but still totally average. Nice wine list and staff.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Given the high Yelp rating, I was truly excited to try this neighborhood Italian place with my husband on a recent Saturday night. I should first say that the atmosphere was lovely - perfect for neighborhood Italian - tables spaced far enough apart, good lighting, nice decor.  The wait staff was also very nice and attentive.  The bread on the table and olive oil were fresh and yummy.

Unfortunately, our dishes were only average.  They are known for their pastas - so I ordered the spinach ravioli with brown butter and sage (and tomato sauce?)  The two sauces did not work together - it was like I had 2 different dishes on one plate.  I ended up scraping the tomato sauce to the side.  And the pasta was too al dente for my taste. My husband had the wild boar ragout over wide noodles.   Again, it was ok - not great.

Wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars - that's probably a more accurate rating for the 4 star atmosphere with the 3 star food. The pricing was good for the entrees - so we'll probably try it again - hopefully we'll  have better luck next time.
author: Nanny M.

description: Great food, great place and super friendly people! Make sure to have a reservation... Always pretty full cause the food is delicious!
author: Bruno V.

description: Really has gone down hill. Used to be our favorite.  Pizza crust was tasteless and the pomodoro was also much different and nearly tasteless. New management?   Won't be back.
author: William O.

description: I would honestly give 4.5 stars if I could.  Yelp needs to catch up with the rest of the world where such is easily doable.  But even at that, this is the highest rating I have ever given any restaurant.  All the food was magnificent, from the warm bread to the cheesecake.  The service started out great, then got a little spotty after the food was received, including a bit of a wait to get my check.  All this while the restaurant was not crowded at all, hence the loss of half a star (if I could).  But I will definitely return.
author: Anthony H.

description: I know I know, I wrote a review just a month ago, but after my last outing, I couldn't resist writing another. The heat wave had just dissipated, so we were walking down Union, after a stroll in the park with our pup, enjoying the "normal" Spring SF temperatures. We walked by Pan e Vino and thought it would be so nice if we could eat our favorite truffle pasta outside with our dog. My hubby figured there was no harm in asking so he went in and talked to the host. Within 30 seconds, he scooped up a table, carried it over his head, and proceeded to set it up outside for us. Now that's service!!!!! We were so appreciative and the great service didn't stop there. I wish I knew our server's name, but he was so friendly and attentive. He always made sure we had enough water in our glasses and oil and bread on the table.  A bus boy even brought or dog some water in a to-go container. It was such a pleasant evening and we are looking forward to returning in the near future for another delicious meal outside with our pup!
author: Kelsey K.

description: We live a few blocks from pane e vino and it always seems crowded, so we decided to try it out. We made a reservation and they sat us ~20 minutes late. After being seated, we had to ask for a drinks menu about ~20 minutes later - they totally forgot about us, which is hard to do in a tiny restaurant. The food wasn't very good at all. We ordered the calamari, which was extremely fishy tasting. We also got the bolognese pasta and margherita pizza. The pizza was the only good thing we had. The worst part? There were all of the gnats flying around - 1 flew into my pasta and we told someone and they just removed that piece of pasta like it was normal with no apologies. So gross! The highlights: pizza and wine. Low points: appetizer, pasta, service, and bugs in food.
author: Jillian P.

description:
Charming atmosphere
Warm waitstaff
Good bread
Authentic, delicious pasta
My friend had the veal chop and he and those who tasted it really liked it
Great choice for Italian to frequent with good friends
author: Chetan I.

description: Very cute neighborhood spot on a fun street to walk around. Sadly, the food was awful. The caprese salad's mozzarella had no taste and they put dried oregano on it. The Sea Bass had a strong fish taste and was completely over cooked. The chicken lasagna had good flavor but was also completely over cooked. The bread and wine were great.
author: Louise S.

description: Lu can not find good Italian in this neighborhood. I was very disappointed. Bread was good. Wine list cheap and good. Minestrone ok. Salad ok. The veal stew and buccatini amatriciana were not good. I wanted to walk out and try another place because I hate eating bad pasta (under seasoned. Watery), but it was too late. I will not go back. Wife did not like it either. Restaurant was full and lots of people seem to like it, though. I do have very high standards for Italian restaurants.
author: nick g.

description:
One of the greatest places to eat in San Francisco! The service, food, and atmosphere feels as if I am in Italy. I would HIGHLY recommend this place to both locals AND tourists.

I would recommend the Fusilli with Eggplant and mozzarella cheese. The smokey flavor really entices you to keep on eating it. I could eat this dish everyday for the rest of my life! Also, the pizzas are to die for!

The waiters and staff at Pane E Vino are some of the most hard working people I've seen in the restaurant world. Fabio, especially, is one of the best servers I've come across. I am aware he has been serving at Pane for many, many years. He is polite, friendly, comical, and on point. I ask to be seated in his section every time I come in to eat. Carlos, the manager, is someone I look forward to seeing when I come in.

I am very surprised there are negative reviews about this restaurant. 5 stars are well deserved!
author: Jacob S.

description: If authentic Italian is what you're after, this is your spot. Some of the best Italian I've ever had - just try to come before 7 if you don't have a reservation - they get very busy around that time.
author: Tina H.

description: Three of us had. Petrale Sole .  We all agreed it was a bit too meaty for sole.  The lemon sauce lacked flavor.  The portions were extremely generous but I not recommend this dish.
author: Susan L.

description: Awesome authentic Italian, from fresh bread to fresh fish, homemade pasta, this is my favorite go to restaurant.
author: James D.

description:
Where do I even begin...
First of all, I live a block from this place (DANGEROUS). It is an adorable little romantic Italian joint, with that mom & pop feel. They have yummy Italian vinos. The minestrone soup was to die for!!! I could seriously eat it everyday! And delectable Veggie Lasagna! this place is a great date spot  : )
author: diane s.

description: nice atmosphere, friendly service,  and generous portions but food was either very bland (seafood appetizer) or very salty (fish of the day).
author: Angela L.

description:
There are many reasons I adore Pane E Vino. 

1. Consistency: the dishes are always the same. No surprises. Everything listed will be on the plate. You bet the roasted half turkey is always cooked juicy to perfection. And that pizza is cooked perfectly, cheese divine, prosciutto top quality, arugula fresh. You get the idea.
2. The owner/manager: charming Argentine man, so kind and always says hello to his locals. He is an absolute pleasure.
3. Ambiance: cozy, warm, bustling. Great place to get out of the fog.
4. Service: efficient. Much like being in Italy - they do not interrupt conversation and are not there to entertain you. They're there to feed you and let you be with your party. They don't hustle you out. The table is yours. You can be the last table in the place and you'll barely notice. They will clean quietly around you.

Perfect place to celebrate, be romantic or catch up with a friend.
author: Meredith R.

description: Great date restaurant. I went there on a date a few weeks ago, and have been there with family many times. The wine selection is great, and the pasta is very good as well.
author: Zach H.

description:
If I could give 0 stars, I would. 

Went here with a group of 14. Granted, we were a large group, but we ordered a lot of food and were courteous. We sat outside where nobody else was sitting- it wasn't terribly busy. The food was so-so, a step above mediocre. I might go back and give it a 2nd chance, except....THE SERVICE WAS GODAWFUL. The staff were rude and they basically didn't give 2 sh*ts that we were paying customers, there to enjoy a nice meal. 

We had to ask for our check at least 3 times, and when they finally brought it, they left it on a nearby table, so I had to stand up, walk over to this table and bring it back to ours. Then, nobody came to pick up our payment for 10-15 minutes. I was fuming so I walked into the indoor part of the restaurant, asked for the manager, and practically had to beg to pay the bill. We should've dined and dashed, maybe then they would've paid some attention to us?? Oh and of course, cuz we were a large group, 18% gratuity was automatically included. I guess they had no incentive to treat us like human beings. 

AVOID.
author: Lanakila T.

description:
Came here with mad craving for bolognese, and on that front, they didn't disappoint.  Their taglitelle alla bolognese is satisfyingly meaty, the perfect sized portion, and served up quick and piping hot.

The bruschetta, on the other hand, was less than perfect.  The bread was charred, and the flavor was nothing to write home about.  At $3 per piece, they had better be out-of-this-world delicious.

In fact, while I did really enjoy the ambiance, service, and bolognese, I flip flop on whether or not it was a good value.  The pasta was $16 a pop... standard for an evening out to dinner, but for some reason I have a hard time justifying the cost in comparison to other cuisine.  However, if you have a craving, like me, or just love Italian, this is a pretty solid place in the neighborhood.
author: Allison B.

description: Good, standard Italian food. Don't expect anything really innovative or authentic - this place is moreso your typical American Italian restaurant. Service was okay and we didn't have to wait long to get a table on a Friday night. There's easily a handful of better Italian places in the area.
author: Gina C.

description: Good, casual, local, clean simple Italian food! great service!
author: Kirk M.

description:
I was so excited to eat here after reading Yelpers reviews.   
The food however ... was just mediocre.    The service was great! 
Great Host ... great wait staff.   Just a little disappointed with the cuisine. 
Pasta Di Mare ...  hardly any pasta noodles and pasta was over cooked - not al dente. 
Sauce tasted great ... just with there was more pasta & wish it was al dente.   We also ordered the Oso Bucco ... was just okay.  The saffron rice didn't really "wow" us.  Seemed like it needed more wine or garlic ... something.  It just tasted like bullion flavored rice.   We also ordered the Pizza Margarita ... it was okay .. pretty good. 
And ... we ordered the fried calamari appetizer.   For some reason they brought us a combo plate with other fried appetizers.  It was okay ... pretty oily and a little chewy. 
What I did love about the restaurant was the atmosphere ... it was charming & romantic.   Would be a great date place ... just wish the cuisine tasted better.  I would not go back here again.   Once is enough for me.
author: Suzie Q.

description: Brought my family here last night, super friendly service, super food and sound levels allowed for easy conversation.  Ordered a Carbonara dish not on the menu, it was outstanding! Five different dishes ordered and all were above average.  The calamaris appetizer was actually large enough for all to enjoy, unlike in many other eateries.  Can't wait to come back.
author: Donald R.

description: We have been eating at Pane e Vino for over 20 years and love the atmosphere, the great staff and the really top notch Italian food.  It is a complete winner.  Every time we are in there, we are treated well, and the food is consistently great.  Judging by the staff interactions with other customers, they clearly have a huge number of other faithful regulars.  We have taken numerous friends there, and have yet to have anyone not really like it.  My cousins from Sweden got married in San Francisco recently, and picked Pane e Vino for their after ceremony dinner, and it was a great experience.
author: Kirk L.

description: Great cozy place. Our pasta was really good. My husband raved about his pasta with mushrooms and truffles. I had the penne with mushrooms and pancetta. The light tomato cream sauce was excellent. The flan I ordered was pretty standard, nothing noteworthy - it was tood bad that the berries it came with were not ripe and didn't add much to the flan. Come here for the pasta!
author: Jenny B.

description: Totally enjoyed our evening! Great service and food!
author: Christine B.

description:
Unfortunately for Pane E Vino, this is one customer that will never return.

A group of 15 ppl, we were placed in the back section. It's a beautiful back room, with clear ceilings so the sunlight can shine in. Flower pots hung from the terrace providing a wonderful outdoor feeling. As the only group in the back, we felt like VIPs! SCORE!!!!! 

...not!

We were neglected. Given menus, the waiter leaves. 15 minutes, 20 minutes. No one come backs. Finally a busboy walks by and we waved him down. He said he'll get the waiter. Another 5 minutes, 10 minutes. Where the hell is the waiter?! The same busboy walks by again. Ummm...we would like to order. He said he'll get the waiter...again.

Moving forward...

The food was good, some more enjoyable than others. Their usual pastas are flavored well. I had order off the special menu, risotto with quail and mushroom. The arborio rice was slightly undercooked (not enough liquid). I was quite surprised that they serve the dish with 2 quails. The quails were quite delicious but difficult to eat. The risotto itself was plain and bland. Had to mix the juice from the quail to actually enjoy it.

So here comes the worse part of the dinner, which made me vow to never come here again...

The total bill came to less than $300, which was pretty good for 15 ppl. 11 people paid in cash with 4 people charging their own portion on their credit card. Our waiter takes our cash and cards. 10 minutes later, it was the manager that returns with the bill and receipts. He goes..."Here are your cards. But there's a problem with the cash." He takes a stack of cash and counts it in front of us. "You guys only paid $97."

OMG. We were all like WTF?! I don't know about other people, but when my friends and I pay as a group, we usually make sure that everyone paid their portion and the bill adds up. 

We were so upset, because here we are, being accused of shortchanging the bill. We had counted $227 in cash and added up the separate credit card charges before handing the waiter our bill. Even if we were off in cash, I don't think we would be short more than $100. We told him we paid more than $200 in cash. And the manager insisted that this is what our waiter had given him, which led us to suspect that the waiter had taken our money.

Time passed and the manager just stood there expecting us to do something. Of course we weren't gonna put in more money, since we KNOW we paid the right amount. Finally, with us not budging, the manager goes out and asks the waiter. THEN...he comes back in and apologize saying that there was a confusion with the bills.

Like the song...it was "too late to apologize". One sorry was not enough. We were disgusted, with the manager, with the accusations, with the whole situation. 

The food is definitely not good enough to make me come back. Never again.
author: Marti L.

description:
I have been coming to this place since its location on Scott Street.  This place was my first carpaccio experience.  I have yet to find a better carpaccio.  This new location also has an outdoor patio, which is cool in times of good weather.
Unfortunately service is lacking.  The servers and host barely speak any English or Italian.  Not the same interest and zeal from the staff as it was 15 years ago.  Times change though.  The food is still good.
author: D B.

description:
I looked this place up on Yelp and expected it to be a great experience based on what I read. However, the only reason it isn't receiving a fourth star is because of the service. The host/manager(?) wasn't the politest to start off. He guided us to the BACK of the restaurant which was still nice but almost abandoned if you will. Then our server took way too long to greet us, but once he did..he was quick and impersonal. I've worked in a restaurant before and I know that the servers are supposed to greet the guests regardless of how busy you are. We had to ask for bread and water refills way too often, it was annoying. The only person that was nice was infact the water boy who of course spoke no english. The server was impatient for the entire meal as well. He wanted us to order pretty much right as he greeted us and didn't care to accomodate my younger sister (she's 10 years old.) I don't care how FINE of dining you think you are, you accomodate your guests regardless. He didn't recommend any dishes suitable for a child her age nor did he take the time to recommend anything to me and my friend. The best part of the meal was of course, the food. We had a margherita pizza, eggplant lasagna, and plain pasta with butter. It was filling and delicious. The server didn't check up on us at all throughout the whole meal which was again, annoying. Like I said, no water refills unless you asked, no bread refills unless you asked, and no conversation...AT all. 
To sum up, he received a poor tip and I probably wouldn't go back unless it was a free meal. Ha.
author: Bree G.

description:
Small neighborhood restaurants are always a favorite of mine. I usually come here w/my favorite Italian :) Makes it that much better! Everyone always greets us kindly and I feel like I'm entering my family's home.

A few of my favs here:
GUAZZETTO DI PESCE
MOZZARELLA ALLA CAPRESE
LINGUINE AI FRUTTI DI MARE
CAPRICCIOSA-pizza
BOSCAIOLA-pizza

If you like whites:
BIANCO DEL FRIULI

If you like reds:
BARBARESCO, Produttori del Barbaresco, Piemonte'06
author: Lola D.

description: Excellent! The appetizer was so fresh, it tasted like the tomato was just picked. Recommend the wood fired pizza! It's large enough to share with 2 people. The waitstaff was excellent and very attentive. Casual atmosphere. Didn't try any wine, but the list was extensive. If you're in the area, definitely visit this place!
author: Ashley C.

description: Food was good, not great. Good atmosphere, and did a nice song+tiramisu for a birthday.
author: Erin F.

description: Went here for a nice evening out and was completely disappointed, I ordered a daily special which was ravioli with ricotta and spinach in tomato sauce, what I got was literally 6 regular sized, under-stuffed ravioli that was incredibly bland in flavor. The ceaser salad I had as an appetizer was also nothing special. I left the restaurant still hungry over a meal I could have made myself with better results. This wasn't my first visit there, but it will be my last.
author: Rachael T.

description: Just edible italian food, not disgusting NOR mind-blowing.  Service was quite slow but we weren't in a hurry and enjoyed eating at the counter watching them assemble pizzas and bread sticks.  So many other places to try in the area, so I wouldn't be back again.
author: Janet L.

description:
OK, here I go again.  I AM a foodie and I have high standards. And I mean that in the best possible way. So take that under advisement.

This is NOT a hidden gem.  This is not a great Italian restaurant. It's been around forever--they moved a few years back, but longevity does not insure high quality.
The food is truly in these days in SF a B-.  They cut corners, they are not in the least bit fresh or creative--it is standard old school not terrible expectable Italio.  The service is pretty good, the ambiance is OK--tables much too close together, crazy Italian pop music too loud.  But sort of fun in a wacko way.  The wine is OK.
I guess they've just been at it too long and need a shot in the arm, like a visit to
a few other Italian restaurants that shine, like_____ and ______.
But I guess it works for them.

You must realize that so many reviews on Yelp are by people in their 20's- 30's who just really don't have much experience or taste.  So, consider the source.  I'm a snob
and a very experienced one.  I admit I ate here out of desperation and wondering if they'd improved since 6 years ago, the last time I went.  Oops.
author: harmonia b.

description: Definitely a meal I won't soon forget! Walked in as a party of 5 without reservations and was politely sat between reservation times on a busy Friday night (Fleet Week). Saw gorgeous mushrooms in the display case so I ordered the pasta, mushroom and truffle special - which was perfectly executed! The table's wines, pizza, buffalo cheese app and olives were also equally delicious. This is an understated memorable dining experience I'll share with good friends and family, for sure.
author: Josh M.

description:
Turning the tables!  Deplorable for a restaurant anywhere less San Francisco. Ah Europe where one can dine without the host or waiters hovering saying, "Take your time" and asking if you want the check.

Good food, good service but leave me alone when I have a $100 tab for 2.
author: Tex M.

description: This is our go to place for Italian and great company. Our little girls love the staff including Carlos the owner and they talk about going to visit him :)
author: Ross M.

description:
Feeling like Italian last night, we ventured in for a bite. It had been a few years since our last visit, and unfortunately, for their location and fierce competition in the neighborhood, the meal was akin to something you could pick up from the frozen section at Safeway. I'm not hating on their establishment, just offering a fair assessment compared to other local places like Campannia or Amarena. 

The baby octopus starter was tasty, however the grilled sausage and 1/2 chicken mains were both dry and average tasting. Service for both the waiter and busser was intermittent and disengaged. I'm not expecting the Danko experience of attention, but some genuine interest in our satisfaction would have been nice. 

Sadly, with all the choices around, we will not be returning here.
author: Informed C.

description: When we're in San Francisco we make sure to dine at Pino e Vino. Every time we're treated as if we are regulars from the neighborhood. Not only is the food delicious, the service is very attentive. I highly recommend Pino e Vino for great "foodie" experience.
author: Angela M.

description:
I would really give this place 3.5 stars for the food, but I'll round up because the service was awesome.

I went here with a few girlfriends last night to celebrate a birthday.  After we walked in, I felt a warm and welcoming atmosphere.  Our server, Favio, was extremely gracious and gregarious.  We got a great round table and a round of champagne and bruschetta on the house (it definitely pays to be a group of laughing ladies!).

I ordered one of the risotto specials ($18): asparagus and rock shrimp.  The portion was just the right amount to fill me up without weighting me down.  It was light yet creamy, savory but not overly salty.  It could have used a bit of heat, but I lived without it.

I really, really loved how they decorated the restaurant.  Salmon colored walls, soft lighting, and Italian ceramics filled the walls.  i actually felt like I was in a small bistro in Italy. 

If I was in the neighborhood again, I would come here.  Parking is a pain, but as it gets later in the evening--Monday-Thurs-- it lightens up.
author: Marissa N.

description:
Favorite place to grab Italian outside of North Beach, and conveniently located close to my girlfriends place. Everything we have had here has been excellent (pizzas, apps, pastas), but I especially love the pappardelle alla contadina (egg pasta w/ chick and mushrooms in tomato cream sauce).

Always over-order, but anything brought home is always gone by the end of the night...
author: Kent S.

description:
I took my parents here for dinner. We had the capellini with fresh crab, sausage on polenta, linguine vongole for dinner,  We all LOVED our dishes. The service was impeccable. They were extremely busy but the wait staff didn't miss a beat.
I am glad to find another great neighborhood restaurant.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I've been all over Italy so I know what real Italian tastes like and Pane E Vino knows what that is as well.  Surprisingly not that many places in SF actually do.   

Pane has a huge variety of pasta, fish, meat and appetizers, everything was very authentic, the bread wasn't great and since it's part of the title and a staple in Italy that is something they should work on.    Some dishes were simple and almost homely and some very elaborate with flavors expertly intertwined together.  Just depends on what you want..  The portions are great too, not too big and of course you have to have wine.  

The courtyard is great too, gives you a completely different feel for dinner.   It can be romantic or just social for a group.  It's like being outside but it's covered so good for any day since we can't really depend on the sun in SF.
author: Inga W.

description: 3 people, 1 appetizer, 3 main courses, 2 desserts, 1 bottle of wine = $125.00. For the food that we received, which was average at best, I consider the food overpriced at $125.00 before tip. I would not go back again. Also, the ambiance combined with the sub-average food made me wonder that Denny's, TGIF Friday's, or a diner would have been a better choice. However, I did like the neighborhood and the surrounding bars.
author: JH J.

description:
Best Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  Amazing pizza, especially the "prosciutto cotto and funghi". I have been going to this place for over 3 years and I am crazy about it.
Very friendly service.
author: Cece P.

description:
Great pizza - very thin crust, not stiny with the toppings. Delicious cheesecake - large and not too sweet (but still not as light as Zanze's). The pastas with fish tasted too fishy. Still good though, but until the fishy taste goes away, I'll give him a higher rating. Great Italian restaurant...I want more.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I know this is a popular place but I was there  a few days ago and the truffle pasta was almost inedible. They must have poured an entire a box of salt in my order.  The canolli dessert was nothing special.  The staff was ok but the young greeter/manager was pushy, loud and  rude with other employees which made the atmosphere stressful.
author: Helen Z.

description:
One of my favorite Italian places in the City, if that tells you anything. 

The place itself is a bit small and always busy, but the hand made pasta is fabulous. Fast, helpful waiters and oh, the food!
author: Ben R.

description:
This is restaurant is absolutely wonderful. Unless....you're a fan of the wanna-be-authentic-italian-restaurant: Olive Garden. {vomit}

My boyfriend celebrated my surprise birthday dinner with friends here. Both the service and food were excellent. Not only was the food fantastic, but they served my cake and our bottle of champagne at the exact time we  asked them too - they were very, very, helpful. The restaurant owner, who is a completely easy going man, was completely helpful in coordinating such a special day.

Now, we celebrate each special day, including our anniversary, at this restaurant. Every time we go, both the service and food meet up to our standards.

Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand, let me tell you - their wine selection - pssssssssst! It's out of this world. 

Although all their dishes are d-licious, both the Gnocchi and the Truffle pasta are to die for!!!! I think they only serve the truffle pasta dish on Mondays though. 

This restaurant is always packed during weekends, and weekday evenings. If you're stopping by during the weekend, be sure to make reservations or expect to possibly wait outside - their {standing} waiting area is teeny tiny, so you'll probably be waiting {standing} outside.
author: Rosa D.

description: I celebrated my birthday here, my friends and I had a great time ! Food was delicious and filling, everybody enjoyed their dishes. Service was also excellent, we stayed until they closed and they never tried to push us out.
author: Mary R.

description:
Delish, delish, delish.
My father moved from Italy about 35 years ago so when he loves a spot, I know it's going to be great.
I recently moved back to SF from a two year stint in Italy and was meeting up with four Italian friends when my dad suggested Pane E Vino. No one was disappointed. 
The service was great, the restaurant is adorable and the food awesome! We love to share in my family, so I sampled a ton of dishes. We had a generous sampling of antipasto and then each got a first course. The porcini with truffle sauce pasta was my favorite, but really, they were all delish.
Yum.
author: Francesca F.

description:
This was a fine dining experience. The host was very friendly and causal, asking us where we would like to sit. The food was decent. I felt that my parpadella pasta was a little salty and so a lot of the ingredients that they put inside didn't come through. However, the noodle itself was really soft, as it should be and the sauce that came with it was thick, the way it should be. 

Staff were friendly as well. The only awkward things that happened were 1) they don't give you plates for bread 2) our food didn't come at the same time. 

Even though Yelp says the dress is casual, I would recommend wearing something dressy casual...if that makes sense...
author: Joyce L.

description:
As I am Italian .... It is not easy for me to find a good Italian restaurant in SF but at Pane e Vino you can find a decent Pizza as they have a brick oven ... you can  try   Pizza Tirolese   or  Pizza quattro formaggi  and  Prosciutto  sometime in the special that you can share  as a starter .
Portions are big for the pizza:) 

I also reccomend to avoid the Pastas in all the Italian Restaurant in San Francisco  and  go directly to the main course Menu  .... 
such as  the Ossobuco ( Veal Shank )  served with Risotto .
For the pasta go on youtube and cook it at home 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QPN1rxOd0-8&feature=related

Buon appetito :)
author: Rudy B.

description:
7:45pm: Arrive on time for our reservation. Seated promptly. 
8:10pm: Place our order for a pizza and a pasta. They ask if we want one to come out first so we say we'll take the pizza first. 
9:05pm: They bring out both dishes at the same time. The pizza is cold. In my mind, my future Yelp review plummets to 2 stars. The pasta is pretty good luckily (and not cold). 
9:10pm: Waiter realizes the pizza didn't come out first and apologizes profusely. Offers dessert on the house to make amends. We don't really want dessert but we take it anyway (I am incapable of turning down free food).  Mental Yelp review goes up to 4. 
9:40pn: Tiramisu arrives. It's decent. I'm happy. 
10:05pm. No sign of the check (or anyone to ask).  Getting sleepy after all the wine. 
10:15: Finally get the check. The dessert is on there. Are you freaking kidding me??? Mental Yelp review nose-dives to 1 star. 
10:25: We finally get the bill fixed. Profuse apologies yet again, mildly eases my frustration. 
Next day: I eat the leftovers and they are DELICIOUS. If only the pizza had been hot originally.

Final verdict? 3 stars. But it was quite a roller coaster.
author: Priya N.

description: I got the special --- spaghetti with Main Lobster. It was only $26 for the entire lobster --- I thought that was a pretty good deal!
author: Karin Z.

description:
I don't like salmon. But, salmon colored walls work surprisingly well for this restaurant.

Came here for a business dinner last night with my coworkers. The restaurant was empty so we didn't have to wait for a table. The menu is pretty extensive, but do yourself a service and order a pizza.

The Puttanesca(w/o Anchovies) was good, but their thin crust pizza's looked friggin delicious. I do plan on going back for their pizza sometime soon. 

What else?! Speedy service, but that could be due to the lack of clientele on a Monday night. They did rush us out as the owner wanted to close early, but apologized profusely. Parking is a bitch. 

Do give it a try
author: Tushar V.

description:
The ambiance is warm and inviting. The menu was creative, seasonal, and varied. The food was beautifully prepared and delicious. We had burrata with radicchio salad from the specials menu and fusilli and Mediterranean sea bass from the regular menu. Every dish had some flavor or side that made it unique. The wine list was extensive. Service friendly but not intrusive.
Pane e Vino is now on my favorite restaurant list.
author: Kendra M.

description:
So, we had a little Acton mini-reunion, but had trouble getting reservations for 16, where 9 of the 16 were kids.  Even in a bad economy, this is not an easy task, but we managed to get a table at Pane E Vino on Tuesday at 6:30.

They were very patient as the arrival time ended up stretching from 6:30-7:00 (understandable if you are a parent).

Free parking is not so easy, but I managed to score rock star parking.  Helps when you are the only single one in the group and you leave work early.

The food was really good.  I had the Pollo Marinato Allo Griglia and the Ahi Salad. I also had some good Italian beer, while most everyone else had something from the killer wine list..

The dessert was ok, but I should have ordered the profiteroles instead of the mela caramellata.  The bill was steep, but considering we hogged the best table in the place for 3 hours while entertaining ourselves of stories of the hometown, it was a small price to pay.
author: Will A.

description: place was ok , food was good , nice to have  dinner out  nothing fancy
author: A. M.

description: Consistently very good.  Their pastas are always on point, and their meats are good too.  Wonderful wine selection and service is always warm and inviting. I've been coming to Pane e Vino with my family since 1993.  We started at the one in Montecito and have since visited LA and SF locations too.   Always a hit!
author: Carrie C.

description:
Can't believe that I've lived across from Ft. Mason for 3 yrs and never been here!
The wait staff was terrific, reminding me of the jovial ones back in Siena, Italy.  I half-expected a 'Ciao bella!' sometime during the meal.

Ordered: whole-wheat pappardelle with roasted duck ragout (special) with homemade noodles.  
Capricciosa flat crust pizza
(Tomato sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, mushrooms, artichokes, olives and oregano)

The pizza was delicious for breakfast and pasta for lunch today. 
I'll definitely be back.  Good thing bikini season is over and I can start indulging in Italian carbs once more.
author: Angela C.

description: Super disappointing.  I'd been here before for a birthday and remember it being great.  Took a date here tonight and the service was terrible.  The waiter seemed off in his own world and not attentive at all.  We kept having to ask for refills on water and no one checked on us throughout the meal.  My date was as unimpressed as I was.  Food was decent, but as I used to work in a restaurant and my date is currently a server, we both will not being going back.  Kinda a buzz kill for us.
author: Michael R.

description: Went here on a whim about a week ago. No reservation, and it was very busy. They apologetically offered a table in the back room - which turned out to be great. It's a covered patio with the ambiance of a grape arbor, and a view of the kitchen complete with cooks rushing around and gleaming copper pots hanging in the window.  If only the food had been as good. I usually order veal the first time at any Italian restaurant - both because I like it and because it's a good gauge of the quality of their cooking. I got the scaloppini in a mushroom sauce and while the sauce was excellent, the veal itself was like cardboard. The bread, with a good dipping oil, was yummy - crusty outside, soft inside. Well of course; it was from Acme. We got the caprese salad, attractively plated, tomato fresh and in season - but the mozzarella fresca was on the firm side. At Il Cortile in NY we were served soft, falling-apart bufala mozzarella, and have rated capreses ever since on that standard. I can't remember the hub's entree at Pane e Vino, and neither can he, but it was equally o-k but not great. On the way out, we saw that the main dining room was dimly lit, loud, and crowded. We were so glad we'd just dropped in and were ushered to the second-class compartment .
author: Leigh G.

description:
The place was full on a Friday night, and I was glad to have made a reservation. We changed the reservation from 4 to 6 a couple hours before and they had no problem changing that, which was appreciated on our part. 

I had the Napoletana thin crust pizza. Very delicious if you like anchovies and capers. If you don't, obviously, there was more going for this pizza than just the anchovies and capers, so I'm sure one of the many choices will satisfy you.

Our table had everything from pizza, to a roasted half-chicken, to a lamb shank, and everyone was satisfied. 

The pizza is the most economical way to go, as I paid $23 (for the $13 pizza and my share of the wine + tax/tip) and still had 4 slices left for a midnight snack and the next day's lunch. 

The decor is very nice here. A homely rustic Italian feel with friendly servers.
author: Saori E.

description:
Pane E Vino is an intimate Italian restaurant full of warmth that offers food rich with color, texture and flavor. 

We love their authentic Italian pizza- thin crust, aromatic with just a handful of high quality ingredients-simple but special. 

I am vegan and they were happy to make my pizza without cheese and it was amazing.
My husband and I enjoyed our meal and service was stellar. We would definitely go back!
author: Sandra S.

description:
Really fresh, authentic Italian food at a very reasonable price.  Plus, they make one of the best thin crust pizzas in the entire city.  I would recommend Pane E Vino with two hearty thumbs up.  (Though make sure to bring your appetite when you dine here, portions are HUGE!)

Note: Technically I think that this restaurant is more in Lower Pac Heights than Union Street/the Marina/Cow Hollow as it's located at the corner of Union and Laguna.
author: Kate R.

description:
I love good food, good service, clean well kept environments and people who love their customers.

I went in with friends on a Saturday night without reservations. The owner was able to make seating for us at a small table and asked if this would be suitable. Ok by me, especially when the aroma of the kitchen is calling my name in a most seductive way.

Wine list, oh my golly golly, one of the finest selections from CA to Italy with premiums by the glass, none of which had the taste of being opened for more than a hour or two.

Must Haves:
Spinach Salad - baby leafs in a warm balsamic with caramelized onion and bacon. Egg and tomato round out for a light dinner selection. I love this salad, simple perfection.

Bistecca - Thick ribeye marinated in olive oil, garlic and rosemary grilled to rare bloody perfection. More meat than the average person can eat. Tender and delicious.

Pollo Griglia - garlicy good, nice balance of spice with tender breast which isn't overcooked and dry. Wonderful dish.

There is a reason why this restaurant still packs them in at dinner. Great food and service with ownership that cares about your experience.

Highly recommended!
author: Steve S.

description: Awesome place for group wining and dining. They have an "outside" area that is still inside but in another section of the restaurant where they place large parties. You definitely miss out on some of the ambiance and a little of service but I felt they were attentive enough. The staff id a great job at waiting a party of close to 20. Food came out on time and delicious. Pizzas were thin and hot. Pastas were fresh and satisfying. Osso Bucco was braised with great love and attention. Very good traditional food and hospitality.
author: Ed L.

description:
Hard to find anything wrong with the dining experience here. The best part of the evening was the great service provided by our waiter. He gave us good advice on what to order. The wine list was extensive, a definite plus. My house salad was excellent, and the chicken was good, a tad dry but more than salvaged by the fresh tomatoes and other vegetables cooked to perfection and served alongside.

I'd definitely come back ... helps that it's perfectly located right in my neighborhood.
author: Brian B.

description:
Had an AMAZING dinner here with my mother the night before she flew home. Found the restaurant on Yelp and decided to give I a try. We arrived late into dinner service, but we're warmly welcomed and attended to promptly.  Our server, Manuel MADE the night perfect and made us feel at home. We shared a carafe of wine after being given a couple of samples to help with our decision. Beef carpaccio was fabulous, with fresh and generous topping of parm-reggiano and capers. Homemade fresh pasta! To die for! Old fashioned technique made it exceptional! Black truffle cream sauce with mixed gourmet mushrooms... I still dream about this dish! Wonderful tiramisu and limoncello.  I can't wait to return! Again, a thanks to Manuel for giving us such a fun and enjoyable evening!
   Sheri
author: Sheri S.

description:
Maybe I didn't order the right thing but my experience here was...meh. I went with my family for my birthday, and it has a great location, but lame atmosphere.  The music was so quiet it almost felt awkward, and there are tacky fake flowers everywhere. Despite this I was still excited since it had a 4 star rating on Yelp and I LOVE me some Italian food.  Our service was great, and we were seated at a great booth table, so things were looking up.  We ordered a delicious bottle of wine--really great wine list. Our food came out very quickly--sausage with polenta, pasta, pork, and salmon.  My sister and I split the sausage and pasta, and neither was mind blowing. I was really disappointed in the pasta and the polenta was absolutely flavorless. My mom was actually a big fan of her pork, but my boyfriend thought the salmon was too fishy. The food wasn't necessarily bad, but it just was not what I expected for 4 stars! After dinner our waiter brought me a tiramisu with a candle, and the dessert was actually delicious!

In summary, the service, wine, and dessert were all amazing, 5 stars on that front, but the food was just a bit disappointing. I'd be willing to try Pane E Vino again, but might get a pizza next time.
author: Julia P.

description: Pane E Vino is one of the few fine, classic neighborhood restaurants left in San Francisco. It's been a favorite of my family's for many years, because of the excellent food, the hospitable, professional service... there are not a lot of places with that sophistication.  It's a relaxing yet elegant restaurant that people who really know the city go to, but it isn't scene-y or self-conscious... so, it makes you feel like a native San Franciscan... albeit one on vacation in Italy!  There are waitstaff that have been there for decades, greet you like family and steer you to the best specials and treats. (A visiting friend who is a denizen of New York's best Italian restaurants was so impressed by our tone-perfect waiter --friendly and entertaining, yet thoroughly professional-- she always asks how she can steal him away to work in New York!) A cozy spot for a couple, but if you're with a few people, you get  to order multiple courses and share everything - from carpaccio to risotto to profiteroles, yum.
author: Megan C.

description:
I liked this restaurant better when it was Via Vie.  The food had a lot of flavor and everything was delicious.  Not so now.

When Pane E Vino was on Fillmore, it was one of THE places to eat -- always a line, one had to have a reservation.  I went there for lunch recently and, not only was I disappointed in the food and service, so were my guests.  I ordered a spinach salad and eggplant parmesan.  They brought the eggplant first, while my guests were waiting for their food.  The food was brought out willy nilly -- not one of us were given our dishes at the same time.  One good thing: my salad was superb.  However, the eggplant was tasteless.  No flavor whatsoever.  I took 2 bites and brought the rest home so I could doctor it up.  One of my guests had puttensca.  She was really looking forward to it, but also took 2 bites and said it didn't have a lot of flavor.

It will be the last time I dine there.
author: Lois L.

description:
I burped up this dinner for hours and even my burps tasted delicious.

The calamari was cooked perfectly and was accompanied by a tasty marinara sauce.

My saffron risotto with lamb shanks and porcini mushroom sauce was absolutely amazing.  I blame burping on this dish.  I kept eating it, even though I was stuffed and practically had to be rolled out of the restaurant.

The tiramisu was good.  Good = nothing is better than Tomasso's tiramisu IMHO....try me.

Service was excellent and I will be back, if I'm stuck in the Marina which I kinda loathe.
author: Christina S.

description: Good food, unpretentious, cool patio with real grape vines (swear those grapes looked fake), reasonably priced.  Waiter encouraged us all to try something a little different and all were satisfied.
author: Grey S.

description: Great authentic Italian food and friendly wait staff.
author: Melinda A.

description: We loved this little restaurant. The pasta dishes are fabulous! It could be the best pasta dish I have ever had. The wait staff is astute and charming. The atmosphere is casual, yet nice. This sounds funny, but the mint they give you with your check  is extra special tasting-I won't describe it so it will be a surprise. Go here for a tasty meal!
author: Karen L.

description:
This place would rate higher, but they don't have their liquor license yet.  What's up with that.  If you can't have a drink when you're eating your meal, why should you go somewhere?

I thought the food was great, but considering the limited options for drinks this place isn't worth a repeat visit.  

Owners - you need to fast track this filing.
author: John M.

description:
Italianfabulous!!! Had an amazing pizza there last night. Arugala, mozarella, bresaola and parmeson cheese. Simply delicious!

My Italien friend from Rome had highly recommended this place, now I understand the hip about it. 

Also had the carpaccio which did not disappoint. I can't wait to head back.
author: Nez B.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. The staff welcomed us in with a smile and sat us down at a front table where we were able to do a little people watching. It's a comfortable setting with a slightly older crowd and many tables seems to be filled with families.
