I like that they have a good variety in their menu (not just pizza and pasta) and good Italian wines (the Valpolicella is very good). The service is friendly and the place is warm and cozy. I highly recommend the Antipasto Della Casa and the Carpaccio to start with. Both are delicious and fun! You'll see what I mean when your order them ;)
author: Loubna M.

description: I went here with a friend who absolutely raved about this place.  The layout is kind of weird but we got a small table in the back.  The best part was the waiter.  I can't remember his name but he would bring out little appetizers and things while we waited for our food.  The food is OK but the servings are really small and the food unremarkable.  Again, the waiter lifted our spirits by bringing us little glasses of lemoncello.  It is to die for and they make it there!  Overall, the food is overpriced for what you get, but if you get this particular waiter, he makes it worth it with the little freebies he brings out.  Oh, and I cracked a crown eating the bread!! '-0  What is it with the TOUGH bread????  And my friend, who had been gushing good things about this place, went one night with her BF, didn't get all of the special treatment and goodies, and now says she hasn't been back since.  Go figure!  Guess it helps if you're female and single, hmm?  I gave it a third star because of the waiter and the extra goodies!!  And I would go back for the lemoncello!  YUMMY!!
author: Paula W.

description: I've been here a few times including this past Monday and think the food is pretty good.  I had the sole and the minestrone soup (soup was better).  The pizzas are really good too!  My biggest complaint is the place is so freakin' crowded which leads to inattentive service and getting bumped into when people are trying to squeeze past your chair.
author: Glen E.

description: I am happy we tried it.  I'm pretty picky about my Italian food, but its in our neighborhood, and I figured we'd give it a go.  The caprese wasn't all that interesting, but the two pastas we had were delicious. Everything seemed fresh.  The service was good and friendly.  I would definitely return.
author: Aimee D.

description:
Even though our meals were pretty dang good (we had the most amazing Fettuccine Ai Formaggi- really the best thick yummy rich cheesy pasta I've had in a long time) I have to take stars away due to the totally lame service. 
My husband and I went there Saturday night and I just had the feeling that our waiter didn't like us for some reason- I tend to be fairly smiley and am rubbed the wrong way when people don't return the gesture- especially when that's their job!!! I just got the sense that he was bothered by our presence. I just noticed Trey c's comment and it sounds like we had similar experience! 
Our waiter topped off his lack of interest in us by completely  disregarding our table after we had our food. I had to ask a bus boy for the dessert menu and the hostess ran my credit card (after it had been sitting on the table for almost 10 mins- even the manager-looking-person walked by and looked at it but did nothing).
Being a former server myself, I'm kinda a stickler about leaving 20% but I okayed my husband to drop it to 15. It would have been less but then I just feel like I'm giving them a reason to be rude to people in hoodies- quite the dilemma :)
It's a shame. I work just a few doors down and would have been excited to have a new favorite pasta place so close- but I really didn't feel welcomed.
author: Robyn K.

description: We selected Pane e Vino because they have a back patio available which we reserved for a birthday party for 20-30 people.  We specifically did not want a "long table" experience because it is difficult for people to mingle.  We confirmed with the restaurant the day before and day of the event.  When we arrived, several of our party had discovered a different group had been given the back patio and we were given a long table in the front.   This was an extremely disappointing situation which effected everyone, especially the person who was celebrating their birthday.   The staff did nothing to help and at the end of the evening lied to us and pretended that they never agreed to give us the patio.  Another member of our party had a similar experience several months ago.  I recommend people not consider this restaurant for any group event, as they are completely unreliable and have a pattern of duplicity.
author: Steve K.

description: the first time i went here the food was to die for. the second time - i got the same dish, it was just okay. i thought it would turn out to be my to-go-italian place to go but after the okay showing the second time - i never went back. a friend swears by this place and he has impeccable taste - so i am going to have to try it again...
author: Miss O.

description: my girlfriend wanted comfort food and she hadnt been here in a while.. i had never been here.. i was the person who nearly licked her bowl clean.. yummy fresh delish pasta.. very enjoyable.. good atmosphere.. will def come again...
author: Aditi M.
